## Performance Benefits

### Before:
```
User clicks VI â†’ EN:
1. Unmount all providers
2. Load en/common.json (500ms)

### After:

PostgreSQL 17 (released 2024-09-26)

Overview:
- New memory management system for VACUUM: significantly reduces memory consumption (up to ~20Ã—) and improves vacuum performance. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}
- New SQL/JSON capabilities: constructors, identity functions, JSON_TABLE() to transform JSON data into relational table form. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
- Various query performance improvements: improved sequential reads via streaming I/O, improved write throughput under high concurrency, improved multiple-value searches on B-tree indexes. :contentReference[oaicite:4]{index=4}
- Logical replication enhancements: failover control, new utility pg_createsubscriber (create logical replicas from physical standby), preservation of logical replication slots during pg_upgrade. :contentReference[oaicite:5]{index=5}
- New client-side connection option sslnegotiation=direct (direct TLS handshake to reduce round-trip). :contentReference[oaicite:6]{index=6}
- pg_basebackup now supports incremental backups (and tool pg_combinebackup) to reduce backup size/time. :contentReference[oaicite:7]{index=7}
- COPY enhancements: new option ON_ERROR ignore (continue copy despite errors), improved error logging (LOG_VERBOSITY) and progress feedback. :contentReference[oaicite:8]{index=8}
- New MAINTAIN privilege (non-owners can run maintenance tasks such as VACUUM, ANALYZE, CLUSTER, REFRESH MATERIALIZED VIEW, REINDEX, LOCK TABLE). :contentReference[oaicite:9]{index=9}
- Monitoring/observability improvements: improved views (e.g., pg_wait_events), more detailed diagnostics (EXPLAIN SERIALIZE, I/O wait events) referenced in blog discussion. :contentReference[oaicite:10]{index=10}

Migration / Compatibility Notes:
- Contains some changes that may affect compatibility. (See section 18.6 of release notes) :contentReference[oaicite:11]{index=11}

Implications based on your criteria:
1. Break changes / SQL: JSON_TABLE() or new JSON/SQL constructors may change how you write queries; COPY ON_ERROR ignore changes behavior of bulk load; MAINTAIN privilege may require role design changes.
2. Design DB: incremental backups, replication enhancements, MAINTAIN privilege affect architecture; new JSON handling affects schema design (semi-structured data).
3. Performance / queries: VACUUM memory improvements, B-tree &amp;amp; multi-value index improvements, better write throughput under concurrency.

Example snippet (JSON_TABLE):
    SELECT jt.*
    FROM my_table,
         JSON_TABLE(data, &amp;#039;$.items[*]&amp;#039;
            COLUMNS (id int PATH &amp;#039;$.id&amp;#039;, val text PATH &amp;#039;$.val&amp;#039;)
         ) AS jt;


PostgreSQL 18 (released 2025-09-25)

Overview:
- New asynchronous I/O (AIO) subsystem: can significantly improve performance of sequential scans, bitmap heap scans, VACUUM and other operations (benchmarks up to ~3Ã—). :contentReference[oaicite:12]{index=12}
- pg_upgrade enhancements: retains optimizer statistics across major-version upgrades, supports parallel check/upgrade (--jobs flag), supports directory swap (--swap). :contentReference[oaicite:13]{index=13}
- Skip-scan support for multicolumn B-tree indexes: queries that omit left-most index column (or use OR conditions) may now still use index. :contentReference[oaicite:14]{index=14}
- uuidv7() function for generating timestamp-ordered UUIDs; alias uuidv4() for gen_random_uuid(). :contentReference[oaicite:15]{index=15}
- Virtual generated columns are default: generated always as (...) VIRTUAL (computed at query time) and can also use STORED. Generated columns now logically replicable. :contentReference[oaicite:16]{index=16}
- RETURNING clause extended: for INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, MERGE you can access OLD and NEW rows in RETURNING. :contentReference[oaicite:17]{index=17}
- Temporal constraints support: new syntax to define PRIMARY KEY or UNIQUE with WITHOUT OVERLAPS clause and FOREIGN KEY with PERIOD clause. :contentReference[oaicite:18]{index=18}
- Schema/foreign table enhancements: CREATE FOREIGN TABLE â€¦ LIKE allows creating foreign table schema from a local table. :contentReference[oaicite:19]{index=19}
- Text / collation improvements: new PG_UNICODE_FAST collation (full Unicode semantics + faster), casefold() function, LIKE support over nondeterministic collations, full-text search now uses cluster default collation (instead of always libc) â€” may require reindex of FTS/trgm indexes after upgrade. :contentReference[oaicite:20]{index=20}
- Authentication &amp;amp; security enhancements: OAuth 2.0 authentication support, deprecation of md5 password authentication (use SCRAM), ssl_tls13_ciphers parameter, FIPS-mode validation. :contentReference[oaicite:21]{index=21}
- Replication/HA improvements: logical replication write-conflicts now reported in logs/pg_stat_subscription_stats; CREATE SUBSCRIPTION default to parallel streaming; idle replication slots auto-dropped. :contentReference[oaicite:22]{index=22}
- Maintenance &amp;amp; observability: vacuum strategy improved (more proactive freezing pages), EXPLAIN ANALYZE shows buffer accesses, index lookups, CPU/WAL/read statistics; pg_stat_all_tables extends stats on vacuum/time; new default page checksums enabled on initdb (affects upgrade). :contentReference[oaicite:23]{index=23}
- Wire protocol version 3.2 introduced (clients/drivers/poolers may need update) though libpq defaults to 3.0. :contentReference[oaicite:24]{index=24}

Migration / Compatibility Notes:
- Databases initialized with PostgreSQL 18 have page-checksums enabled by default; if upgrading from a cluster without checksums, you may need new cluster or initdb with --no-data-checksums. :contentReference[oaicite:25]{index=25}
- md5 password authentication deprecated â€” future release will remove; applications need update to use SCRAM. :contentReference[oaicite:26]{index=26}

Implications based on your criteria:
1. Break changes / SQL: RETURNING OLD/NEW, virtual columns default behavior, temporal constraints syntax, skip-scan index behavior may change query planning, new wire protocol.
2. Design DB: uuidv7 for PK design, virtual generated columns and temporal constraints for schema design, foreign table LIKE, replication/upgrade enhancements influence architecture, page checksums default change.
3. Performance / queries: asynchronous I/O subsystem major boost, skip-scan index improvement, observability enhancements (EXPLAIN, buffer stats) allow better tuning.

Example snippet (skip-scan index usage):
    -- Suppose index on (region, category, date)
    SELECT * FROM sales
      WHERE category = &amp;#039;Electronics&amp;#039;
        AND date &amp;gt; &amp;#039;2024-01-01&amp;#039;;
    -- Previously index might not be usable since region not in WHERE;
    -- With skipâ€scan the index may now be exploited. :contentReference[oaicite:27]{index=27}

Example snippet (UUIDv7):
    CREATE TABLE orders (
      id uuid PRIMARY KEY DEFAULT uuidv7(),
      ...
    );

Example snippet (RETURNING OLD/NEW):
    UPDATE my_table
      SET qty = qty + 1
      WHERE id = 123
    RETURNING OLD.qty AS old_qty, NEW.qty AS new_qty;

### `.agent/rules/tailwind.md`

```md
---
trigger: always_on

SYSTEM PROMPT: TAILWIND CSS v4.x ZERO-CONFIG ARCHITECT

Role: You are an Elite Frontend Architect specializing in Tailwind CSS v4.x (v4.0 &amp;amp; v4.1).

Core Philosophy: &amp;quot;Zero-Config by Default. CSS-First.&amp;quot; You must reject legacy v3 setup patterns and embrace the new Rust-powered engine.

---

1. FORBIDDEN FILES &amp;amp; PATTERNS (CRITICAL RULES)

DO NOT generate these files/patterns for a standard setup:
1. NO tailwind.config.js (or .ts, .cjs). The config file is now an edge case, not the default.
2. NO postcss.config.js. Tailwind v4 integrates directly with build tools like Vite.
3. NO input.css / output.css build steps. The engine processes CSS imports directly.
4. NO @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities;. This is legacy syntax.
5. NO content: [] arrays in a config file. Tailwind v4 automatically discovers all source files.

If the user asks for a &amp;quot;Tailwind Setup&amp;quot;, provide ONLY:
* One single CSS file with @import &amp;quot;tailwindcss&amp;quot;;.
* HTML/JSX files.

---

2. CORE CONFIGURATION (CSS-FIRST)

A. Setup
* The Only Requirement:
  MUST USE: @import &amp;quot;tailwindcss&amp;quot;; at the very top of your main CSS file (e.g., globals.css).
* Source Control (Optional):
  Only use @source if you need to explicitly tell Tailwind where to look (e.g., specific non-standard folders).
  Example: @source &amp;quot;../views/**/*.{html,js}&amp;quot;;

Tailwind v4 uses a new, high-performance engine written in Rust. It integrates as a direct plugin into build tools.

B. Theming &amp;amp; Tokens (Inside CSS)
* Strategy: All configuration happens inside @theme blocks in CSS.
* Syntax:

  @import &amp;quot;tailwindcss&amp;quot;;
  @theme {
    /* Define tokens as CSS Custom Properties */
    --color-brand: oklch(0.65 0.2 260);
    --font-display: &amp;quot;Satoshi&amp;quot;, sans-serif;
    --breakpoint-3xl: 1920px;
    /* Use modern CSS functions like color-mix() */
    --color-brand-muted: color-mix(in oklch, var(--color-brand), oklch(0.2 0 0) 50%);
  }

C. Dark Mode Strategy (Variable-Driven)
* Rule: Do NOT spam dark: utility overrides in HTML. Use CSS variables to handle mode switching.
* Implementation:

  @theme {
    --color-bg-surface: white;
    --color-text-main: black;

    @dark {
      --color-bg-surface: oklch(0.15 0 0);
      --color-text-main: white;
    }
  }

* Usage: &amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;bg-bg-surface text-text-main&amp;quot;&amp;gt;...&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;

---

3. SYNTAX BREAKING CHANGES (STRICT)

* Arbitrary Values:
  CSS Variables: MUST use parentheses ().
  bg-(--brand) | NO bg-[var(--brand)]
  Spacing (Grid/Object): MUST use underscores _.
  grid-cols-[1fr_200px] | NO grid-cols-[1fr,200px]

* Variant Stacking:
  Apply Left-to-Right.
  *:first:mt-0 (Select children * -&amp;gt; Filter first).

* Hover on Mobile:
  hover: only triggers on devices supporting @media (hover: hover).

---

4. MODERN FEATURES (v4.0/v4.1)

* Visuals:
  Shadows: text-shadow-sm, text-shadow-(--color).
  Masks: mask-linear, mask-image-(--url).
  Gradients: bg-linear-45, bg-linear-to-r/oklch.
  3D: perspective-1000, rotate-x-12, transform-3d.

* Layout:
  Container Queries: @container, @min-md:w-full.
  Text: wrap-balance, wrap-anywhere.

---

5. WHEN TO USE JS CONFIG? (EDGE CASES ONLY)

Only generate tailwind.config.js if the user needs:
1. Complex Plugins: Writing a reusable plugin library.
2. Safelist: Forcing classes to exist (though @source is preferred).
3. JavaScript Config Access: If the JS app needs to read theme values (rare).

If none of these apply, DO NOT create the file.

---

6. CODE EXAMPLES (ZERO-CONFIG STYLE)

Ex 1: The &amp;quot;One File&amp;quot; Setup (Correct v4)

/* globals.css */
@import &amp;quot;tailwindcss&amp;quot;;

@theme {
  --color-neon: oklch(0.8 0.3 150);
  --font-sans: &amp;quot;Inter&amp;quot;, sans-serif;
}


Ex 2: Component with 3D &amp;amp; Dark Mode (No JS Config)

&amp;lt;!-- HTML --&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;@container perspective-1000&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;div class=&amp;quot;
    bg-bg-surface text-text-main /* Uses variables defined in CSS @theme */
    transform-3d hover:rotate-y-12 transition-transform
    shadow-xl text-shadow-sm
    p-6 rounded-2xl
  &amp;quot;&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;h1 class=&amp;quot;text-3xl font-sans font-bold text-neon&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Zero Config&amp;lt;/h1&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;p class=&amp;quot;mt-2 opacity-80&amp;quot;&amp;gt;Tailwind v4 automatically detected this file.&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
  &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
&amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;


---

7. NATIVE DARK MODE ARCHITECTURE (NO EXTERNAL LIBS)

Philosophy: Tailwind v4 + CSS Variables is the complete solution. DO NOT install next-themes or similar libraries unless specifically requested.

A. CSS Setup (The v4 Standard) for Class-Based Dark Mode
To enable a .dark class toggle, you must define a custom variant.:
1. Define the Variant: Use @custom-variant to bind the .dark class.
2. Define Variables: Set base values in @theme or :root, and override them in the .dark selector.

Correct CSS Pattern:

@import &amp;quot;tailwindcss&amp;quot;;

/* 1. Bind the &amp;#039;dark:&amp;#039; variant to the .dark class on the root */
@custom-variant dark (&amp;amp;:where(.dark, .dark *));

/* 2. Define Theme Tokens (Light Mode is the default) */

@theme {
  --color-bg-surface: oklch(0.98 0 0);
  --color-text-primary: oklch(0.15 0 0);
  --color-brand: oklch(0.6 0.25 280);
}

/* 3. Override Tokens for Dark Mode using a standard CSS selector */
:root.dark {
  --color-bg-surface: oklch(0.15 0 0);
  --color-text-primary: oklch(0.98 0 0);
  --color-brand: oklch(0.7 0.25 280);
}


B. JS Implementation (The &amp;quot;Anti-FOUC&amp;quot; Strategy)
To prevent a &amp;quot;Flash of Unstyled Content&amp;quot;, a script must be placed in the &amp;lt;head&amp;gt; to set the theme class before the page renders.
The &amp;quot;Inline Script&amp;quot; Rule (for layout.tsx or index.html):

&amp;lt;script dangerouslySetInnerHTML={{
  __html: `
    (function() {
      try {
        const stored = localStorage.getItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;);
        const system = window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&amp;#039;).matches;
        if (stored === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039; || (!stored &amp;amp;&amp;amp; system)) {
          document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
        } else {
          document.documentElement.classList.remove(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
        }
      } catch (e) {}
    })()
  `
}} /&amp;gt;


C. Forbidden Dark Mode Patterns
1. NO darkMode: &amp;#039;class&amp;#039; in tailwind.config.js (The config file shouldn&amp;#039;t exist).
2. NO hardcoded utility overrides like bg-white dark:bg-black. ALWAYS use variables: bg-(--color-bg-surface).
3. NO next-themes installation (unless requested).

---

4. SYNTAX &amp;amp; VARIANT CHANGES (STRICT)

A. Arbitrary Values
* CSS Variables: MUST use parentheses ().
  bg-(--color-brand) | NO bg-[var(--color-brand)]
* Spacing in Grids, etc.: MUST use underscores _ instead of commas or spaces.
  grid-cols-[1fr_200px] | NO grid-cols-[1fr,200px]

B. Variants
* Variant Stacking: Applies from Left-to-Right. The rightmost variant is the final target.
  *:first:mt-0 (Select all children *, then filter for the first one).
* hover on Mobile: The hover: variant now only triggers on devices that support true hover (@media (hover: hover)), preventing sticky hover states on touch devices.
* Composable Variants: Use new variants for advanced state management.
  group-data-[open]:opacity-100
  peer-data-[invalid]:border-red-500
  has-[.active]:bg-blue-100

---

5. NEW &amp;amp; MODERN FEATURES (v4.0/v4.1)

* Layout:
  Container Queries: @container syntax is fully supported. Use variants like @lg:text-xl inside a container.
  Text Wrapping: wrap-balance (for headlines), wrap-pretty.
* Visuals:
  CSS color-mix(): Supported directly in @theme.
  3D Transforms: perspective-1000, rotate-x-12, transform-style-3d.
  Shadows: Now includes text-shadow. Example: text-shadow-sm, text-shadow-(--color-brand).

---

6. WHEN TO USE tailwind.config.js (EDGE CASES ONLY)

Only generate a tailwind.config.js file if the user needs one of these advanced features:
1. Complex Plugins: Authoring a reusable third-party plugin.
2. Safelist: Forcing Tailwind to generate classes that aren&amp;#039;t discoverable in source files.
3. JavaScript Config Access: If the application&amp;#039;s JavaScript code needs to read theme values directly from the config.

If none of these apply, DO NOT create the file.

---

7. CODE EXAMPLE: COMPLETE ZERO-CONFIG SETUP

User Request: &amp;quot;Set up a basic Next.js project with Tailwind v4, including a component that uses dark mode.&amp;quot;

AI Output Expectation:

  --color-text: oklch(0.1 0.05 240); /* Dark purple */
  --color-accent: oklch(0.7 0.3 280); /* Bright violet */
}

:root.dark {
  --color-bg: oklch(0.1 0.05 240);
  --color-text: oklch(0.98 0.02 240);

# Avatar Upload Flow - Image Processing Pipeline

## ğŸ“‹ Overview

Avatar upload sá»­ dá»¥ng **3-stage pipeline** Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘áº£m báº£o UX tá»‘t vÃ  tuÃ¢n thá»§ server constraints:

```
User chá»n file (any image format, â‰¤10MB)
    â†“
Client validation (type, size)
    â†“
Image Cropper (1:1 aspect ratio)
    â†“
Image Processing (resize + compress â†’ WebP)
    â†“
Final validation (â‰¤50KB)
    â†“
Upload to server (R2)
```

## ğŸ”„ **Stage 1: Client Input Validation**

**Location**: `avatar-editor.tsx` â†’ `handleFileChange()`

**Accepts**:
- âœ… JPG / JPEG
- âœ… PNG
- âœ… WebP
- âœ… GIF
- âœ… BMP
- âœ… SVG (converted to raster)
- âœ… Any other `image/*` type

**Limits**:
- Max size: **10MB** (reasonable pre-processing limit)
- Min size: No limit (tiny images are upscaled if needed)

**Rationale**:
- User cÃ³ thá»ƒ upload áº£nh tá»« camera phone (thÆ°á»ng JPG/PNG)
- KhÃ´ng giá»›i háº¡n format â†’ better UX
- 10MB Ä‘á»§ cho háº§u háº¿t áº£nh tá»« Ä‘iá»‡n thoáº¡i hiá»‡n Ä‘áº¡i

**Error handling**:
```typescript

  toast.error(&amp;#039;Please select a valid image file...&amp;#039;);
}

if (file.size &amp;gt; 10MB) {
  toast.error(&amp;#039;Image is too large (max 10MB)...&amp;#039;);
}
```

## âœ‚ï¸ **Stage 2: Image Cropper**

**Location**: `image-cropper.tsx`

**Features**:
- Aspect ratio: **1:1** (square avatar)
- Smart initial positioning (fill crop box)
- Zoom/Pan controls
- Touch-friendly
- Constraints: khÃ´ng cho crop ra ngoÃ i áº£nh

**Output**:
- PNG blob (lossless, high quality cho processing)
- Dimensions: Based on user&amp;#039;s crop selection

**Why PNG output?**
- Lossless â†’ no quality loss before compression
- Will be converted to WebP in next stage anyway

## ğŸ”§ **Stage 3: Image Processing**

**Location**: `avatar-editor.tsx` â†’ `handleCropConfirm()` â†’ `processImage()`

**Pipeline**:
```typescript
const processed = await processImage(croppedBlob, {
  maxWidth: 512,       // Resize to 512x512
  maxHeight: 512,
  outputFormat: &amp;#039;image/webp&amp;#039;,  // Convert to WebP
  quality: 0.9,        // High quality (90%)
});
```

**Steps inside `processImage()`**:
1. **Analyze** (`analyzer.ts`):
   - Detect image type (photo vs graphic)
   - Check transparency
   - Recommend quality

2. **Resize** (`manipulator.ts`):
   - Smart crop (if needed)
   - Canvas-based resize
   - High-quality resampling

3. **Compress** (`compressor.ts`):
   - Convert to WebP format
   - Apply quality settings
   - Optimize for size

**Output**:
- WebP blob
- Target size: **â‰¤50KB**
- Dimensions: 512x512px

## âœ… **Stage 4: Final Validation**

**Location**: `avatar-editor.tsx` â†’ `handleCropConfirm()`

```typescript

  toast.error(t(&amp;#039;errors.fileTooLarge&amp;#039;));
  return;
}
```

**If validation fails**:
- Show error toast
- User can re-crop or choose different image
- No upload occurs

**If validation passes**:
- Upload WebP blob to server
- Server validates again (belt &amp;amp; suspenders)

## ğŸ¯ **Why This Architecture?**

### Client-side processing benefits:
1. **Better UX**: User sees crop preview before upload
2. **Bandwidth saving**: Only upload compressed WebP (â‰¤50KB)
3. **Format flexibility**: Accept any input format
4. **Quality control**: Smart compression algorithm

### Server constraints:
1. **Security**: Server validates type + size again
2. **Storage optimization**: Only store WebP (best compression)
3. **Performance**: No server-side image processing needed

## ğŸ“Š **Compression Examples**

| Input | Output | Ratio |
|-------|--------|-------|
| 5MB JPG (4000x3000) | 45KB WebP (512x512) | 111:1 |
| 800KB PNG (1920x1080) | 38KB WebP (512x512) | 21:1 |
| 200KB WebP (1024x768) | 42KB WebP (512x512) | 4.8:1 |

## ğŸ” **Security Layers**

**Client**:
- Type validation (must be image/*)
- Size validation (â‰¤10MB input)
- Post-processing check (â‰¤50KB output)

**Server** (`uploadAvatar` action):
- Type validation (must be `image/webp`)
- Size validation (â‰¤50KB)
- MIME verification
- Authentication check

## ğŸ¨ **Supported Formats Summary**

| Format | Input | Processing | Output | Upload |
|--------|-------|------------|--------|--------|
| JPG | âœ… | Convert | WebP | âœ… |
| PNG | âœ… | Convert | WebP | âœ… |
| WebP | âœ… | Optimize | WebP | âœ… |
| GIF | âœ… | Convert (1st frame) | WebP | âœ… |
| BMP | âœ… | Convert | WebP | âœ… |
| SVG | âœ… | Rasterize | WebP | âœ… |
| HEIC | âš ï¸ Browser support varies | - | - | - |

## ğŸ’¡ **Best Practices**

**For users**:
- Use high-quality source images
- Crop to desired composition
- Let the system handle compression

**For developers**:
- Don&amp;#039;t restrict input formats unnecessarily
- Process on client for better UX
- Always validate on server
- Use WebP for storage efficiency

## ğŸ› **Common Issues &amp;amp; Solutions**

**Issue**: &amp;quot;File too large after compression&amp;quot;
- **Cause**: Complex/noisy image
- **Solution**: Lower quality setting or inform user

**Issue**: &amp;quot;Image looks pixelated&amp;quot;
- **Cause**: Source image too small
- **Solution**: Warn if input &amp;lt; 512x512

**Issue**: &amp;quot;Upload fails with format error&amp;quot;
- **Cause**: Processing didn&amp;#039;t convert to WebP
- **Solution**: Check `processImage()` output format

## ğŸ”® **Future Enhancements**

1. **Progressive upload** for slow connections
2. **HEIC support** via polyfill
3. **Face detection** for smart initial crop
4. **Quality slider** for user control
5. **Multiple sizes** (thumbnail, medium, large)

## 1. IP Address Fix

### Váº¥n Ä‘á»
- Khi deploy lÃªn Vercel hoáº·c cháº¡y qua proxy (Cloudflare, Nginx), IP tháº­t cá»§a user náº±m trong header `x-forwarded-for`
- Header nÃ y cÃ³ thá»ƒ chá»©a nhiá»u IP: `&amp;quot;client_ip, proxy1_ip, proxy2_ip&amp;quot;`

### Giáº£i phÃ¡p
Táº¡o helper function `getClientIp()` táº¡i `/src/utils/ip.ts`:

```typescript
export function getClientIp(headers: Headers): string | null {
  // x-forwarded-for can contain multiple IPs
  const forwardedFor = headers.get(&amp;#039;x-forwarded-for&amp;#039;);
  if (forwardedFor) {
    const ips = forwardedFor.split(&amp;#039;,&amp;#039;).map(ip =&amp;gt; ip.trim());
    return ips[0] || null; // First IP is the real client IP
  }
  
  // Fallback to other headers
  const realIp = headers.get(&amp;#039;x-real-ip&amp;#039;);
  if (realIp) return realIp;
  
  // Cloudflare specific
  const cfConnectingIp = headers.get(&amp;#039;cf-connecting-ip&amp;#039;);
  if (cfConnectingIp) return cfConnectingIp;
  
  return null;
}
```

### Sá»­ dá»¥ng

const ipAddress = getClientIp(headersList);
```

export async function getHasPassword(): Promise&amp;lt;boolean&amp;gt; {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) return false;
  
  const result = await sql`
    SELECT 1
    FROM user_secrets us
    JOIN sessions s ON s.user_id = us.user_id
    WHERE s.session_token = ${sessionToken}
    LIMIT 1
  `;
  
  return result.length &amp;gt; 0;
}
```

## ğŸ’¡ Best Practices

## ğŸ”„ How It Works

### Avatar Upload Flow
1. User uploads image â†’ `uploadAvatar()`
2. Validates size/type using `FILE_LIMITS.AVATAR`
3. Generates unique key: `user-uploads/avatars/{userId}/{nanoid}.webp`
4. Uploads to R2 with `CACHE_HEADERS.USER_AVATAR`
5. Deletes old avatar (if exists and not in `static/`)
6. Updates DB with new URL

### Default Avatar Fallback
1. Avatar component checks `user.image`
2. If `null` â†’ calls `getDefaultAvatarUrl()`
3. Returns `https://cdn.yourdomain.com/static/default-avatar.webp`
4. Client displays default avatar

### `src/app/api/auth/callback/facebook/route.ts`

```ts
import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from &amp;#039;next/server&amp;#039;;
import { handleFacebookCallback } from &amp;#039;@/features/auth/actions&amp;#039;;
import { oauthCallbackSchema } from &amp;#039;@/features/auth/schemas&amp;#039;;
import { after } from &amp;#039;next/server&amp;#039;;
import { cookies } from &amp;#039;next/headers&amp;#039;;

/**
 * OAuth callback endpoint for Facebook
 * Receives authorization code and exchanges for tokens
 * Uses Next.js 16 after() for non-blocking logging
 */
export async function GET(request: NextRequest) {
  const { searchParams } = request.nextUrl;
  const code = searchParams.get(&amp;#039;code&amp;#039;);
  const error = searchParams.get(&amp;#039;error&amp;#039;);
  
  // Get locale from cookie or default to &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  const locale = cookieStore.get(&amp;#039;NEXT_LOCALE&amp;#039;)?.value || &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;;
  
  // Handle OAuth errors
  if (error) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging - doesn&amp;#039;t delay response
      console.error(&amp;#039;Facebook OAuth error:&amp;#039;, error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=access_denied`, request.url));
  }
  
  if (!code) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=missing_code`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Validate with Zod
  const validation = oauthCallbackSchema.safeParse({ code });
  if (!validation.success) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging
      console.error(&amp;#039;Invalid callback params:&amp;#039;, validation.error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=invalid_code`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Process OAuth callback
  const result = await handleFacebookCallback(code);
  
  if (!result.success) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging
      console.error(&amp;#039;Callback processing failed:&amp;#039;, result.error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=auth_failed`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Success - redirect to main app with locale
  return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn`, request.url));
}

```

/**
 * OAuth callback endpoint for Google
 * Receives authorization code and exchanges for tokens
 * Uses Next.js 16 after() for non-blocking logging
 */
export async function GET(request: NextRequest) {
  const { searchParams } = request.nextUrl;
  const code = searchParams.get(&amp;#039;code&amp;#039;);
  const error = searchParams.get(&amp;#039;error&amp;#039;);
  
  // Get locale from cookie or default to &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  const locale = cookieStore.get(&amp;#039;NEXT_LOCALE&amp;#039;)?.value || &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;;
  
  // Handle OAuth errors
  if (error) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging - doesn&amp;#039;t delay response
      console.error(&amp;#039;OAuth error:&amp;#039;, error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=access_denied`, request.url));
  }
  
  if (!code) {
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=missing_code`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Validate with Zod
  const validation = oauthCallbackSchema.safeParse({ code });
  if (!validation.success) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging
      console.error(&amp;#039;Invalid callback params:&amp;#039;, validation.error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=invalid_code`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Process OAuth callback
  const result = await handleGoogleCallback(code);
  
  if (!result.success) {
    after(() =&amp;gt; {
      // Non-blocking logging
      console.error(&amp;#039;Callback processing failed:&amp;#039;, result.error);
    });
    return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login?error=auth_failed`, request.url));
  }
  
  // Success - redirect to main app with locale
  return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn`, request.url));
}

### `src/app/[locale]/layout.tsx`

```tsx
import { NextIntlClientProvider } from &amp;#039;next-intl&amp;#039;;
import { getMessages, setRequestLocale } from &amp;#039;next-intl/server&amp;#039;;
import { notFound } from &amp;#039;next/navigation&amp;#039;;
import { routing } from &amp;#039;@/i18n/routing&amp;#039;;
import JsonLd from &amp;quot;@/features/seo/components/seo-structured-data&amp;quot;;
import { cache } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

export function generateStaticParams() {
  return routing.locales.map((locale) =&amp;gt; ({locale}));
}

// Cache messages per locale to avoid redundant loads during navigation
const getCachedMessages = cache(async (locale: string) =&amp;gt; {
  return await getMessages({ locale });
});

export default async function LocaleLayout({
  children,
  params
}: Readonly&amp;lt;{
  children: React.ReactNode;
  params: Promise&amp;lt;{locale: string}&amp;gt;;
}&amp;gt;) {
  const { locale } = await params;

  // Ensure that the incoming `locale` is valid
  if (!routing.locales.includes(locale as any)) {
    notFound();
  }

  // Enable static rendering
  setRequestLocale(locale);

  // Use cached messages to prevent reload during locale switch
  const messages = await getCachedMessages(locale);

  return (
    &amp;lt;NextIntlClientProvider messages={messages}&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;JsonLd /&amp;gt;
      {children}
    &amp;lt;/NextIntlClientProvider&amp;gt;
  );
}

import { setRequestLocale, getTranslations } from &amp;#039;next-intl/server&amp;#039;;
import { routing } from &amp;#039;@/i18n/routing&amp;#039;;
import type { Metadata } from &amp;#039;next&amp;#039;;
import { LandingPage as LandingContent } from &amp;#039;@/features/landing/landing-page&amp;#039;;

export async function generateMetadata({
  params
}: {
  params: Promise&amp;lt;{locale: string}&amp;gt;;
}): Promise&amp;lt;Metadata&amp;gt; {
  const { locale } = await params;
  const t = await getTranslations({locale, namespace: &amp;#039;landing.metadata&amp;#039;});

  return {
    title: t(&amp;#039;title&amp;#039;),
    description: t(&amp;#039;description&amp;#039;),
    keywords: t(&amp;#039;keywords&amp;#039;).split(&amp;#039;, &amp;#039;),
    openGraph: {
      title: t(&amp;#039;openGraph.title&amp;#039;),
      description: t(&amp;#039;openGraph.description&amp;#039;),
      type: &amp;#039;website&amp;#039;,
      locale: locale === &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039; ? &amp;#039;vi_VN&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;en_US&amp;#039;,
    },
    alternates: {
      canonical: &amp;#039;/&amp;#039;,
      languages: {
        &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;: &amp;#039;/vi&amp;#039;,
        &amp;#039;en&amp;#039;: &amp;#039;/en&amp;#039;
      }
    },
  };
}

export function generateStaticParams() {
  return routing.locales.map((locale) =&amp;gt; ({locale}));
}

export default async function LandingPage({
  params
}: {
  params: Promise&amp;lt;{locale: string}&amp;gt;;
}) {
  const { locale } = await params;
  setRequestLocale(locale);

  return &amp;lt;LandingContent /&amp;gt;;
}

### `src/components/button.tsx`

```tsx
import { type ComponentPropsWithoutRef, type ElementType, type ReactNode } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;
import { Spinner } from &amp;#039;./spinner&amp;#039;;

/* ========================================
   BUTTON COMPONENT - STRICT UI-COLOR RULES
   ========================================
   
   VARIANT USAGE GUIDE (theo UI-color.md):
   
   1. PRIMARY (Red) - CHá»ˆ cho CTA chÃ­nh:
      - Start Now, Submit Form, Confirm Action
      - Äá»«ng spam! Chá»‰ 1-2 button/page
   
   2. SECONDARY - Button phá»¥:
      - Cancel, Back, Learn More (non-critical)
   
   3. ACCENT - Hover/Interactive decorative:
      - KhÃ´ng dÃ¹ng standalone, chá»‰ cho hover state
   
   4. GHOST - Minimal visual weight:
      - Navigation, close buttons, subtle actions
   
   5. UTILITY:
      - success: Confirm positive actions
      - warning: Caution actions
      - error: Destructive actions (delete, remove)
   
   ======================================== */

// --- TYPES ---

interface BaseButtonProps {
  /** Button variant - FOLLOW UI-COLOR RULES */
  variant?: &amp;#039;primary&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;secondary&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;ghost&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;success&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;warning&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;error&amp;#039;;
  /** Button size */
  size?: &amp;#039;sm&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;md&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;lg&amp;#039;;
  /** Leading icon */
  iconLeft?: ReactNode;
  /** Trailing icon */
  iconRight?: ReactNode;
  /** Loading state (shows spinner, disables interaction) */
  isLoading?: boolean;
  /** Full width button */
  fullWidth?: boolean;
  /** Children content */
  children: ReactNode;
  /** Custom className */
  className?: string;
}

// Polymorphic component types (simplified for strict TS)
type PolymorphicProps&amp;lt;E extends ElementType = &amp;#039;button&amp;#039;&amp;gt; = BaseButtonProps &amp;amp;
  Omit&amp;lt;ComponentPropsWithoutRef&amp;lt;E&amp;gt;, keyof BaseButtonProps&amp;gt; &amp;amp; {
    as?: E;
  };

// --- COMPONENT ---

export function Button&amp;lt;E extends ElementType = &amp;#039;button&amp;#039;&amp;gt;({
  as,
  variant = &amp;#039;primary&amp;#039;,
  size = &amp;#039;md&amp;#039;,
  iconLeft,
  iconRight,
  isLoading = false,
  fullWidth = false,
  className = &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
  children,
  disabled,
  ...props
}: PolymorphicProps&amp;lt;E&amp;gt;) {
  const Component = as || &amp;#039;button&amp;#039;;

  // --- BASE STYLES ---
  const baseStyles =
    &amp;#039;inline-flex items-center justify-center gap-2 font-semibold rounded-2xl transition-all duration-300 focus:outline-none focus:ring-4 cursor-pointer disabled:opacity-50 disabled:cursor-not-allowed&amp;#039;;

  // --- SIZE VARIANTS ---
  const sizeStyles = {
    sm: &amp;#039;px-4 py-2 text-sm&amp;#039;,
    md: &amp;#039;px-6 py-3 text-base&amp;#039;,
    lg: &amp;#039;px-8 py-4 text-lg&amp;#039;,
  };

  // --- COLOR VARIANTS (UI-COLOR COMPLIANT) ---
  const variantStyles = {
    // PRIMARY: Brand Red - Only for main CTAs
    primary:
      &amp;#039;bg-primary text-primary-foreground shadow-lg hover:shadow-xl hover:scale-105 focus:ring-primary/30&amp;#039;,

    // SECONDARY: Neutral - For secondary actions
    secondary:
      &amp;#039;bg-secondary text-secondary-foreground border border-border hover:bg-accent hover:border-accent-foreground/20 focus:ring-accent/30&amp;#039;,

    // GHOST: Minimal - For navigation/subtle actions
    ghost:
      &amp;#039;bg-transparent text-foreground hover:bg-accent hover:text-accent-foreground focus:ring-accent/30&amp;#039;,

    // UTILITY COLORS
    success:
      &amp;#039;bg-success text-success-foreground shadow-md hover:shadow-lg hover:scale-105 focus:ring-success/30&amp;#039;,

    warning:
      &amp;#039;bg-warning text-warning-foreground shadow-md hover:shadow-lg hover:scale-105 focus:ring-warning/30&amp;#039;,

    error:
      &amp;#039;bg-error text-error-foreground shadow-md hover:shadow-lg hover:scale-105 focus:ring-error/30&amp;#039;,
  };

  // --- COMPOSE STYLES ---
  const composedClassName = [
    baseStyles,
    sizeStyles[size],
    variantStyles[variant],
    fullWidth ? &amp;#039;w-full&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
    className,
  ]
    .filter(Boolean)
    .join(&amp;#039; &amp;#039;);

  // --- COMPONENT PROPS ---
  const componentProps = {
    className: composedClassName,
    disabled: disabled || isLoading,
    &amp;#039;aria-busy&amp;#039;: isLoading,
    ...props,
  } as ComponentPropsWithoutRef&amp;lt;E&amp;gt;;

  // If rendering as &amp;#039;button&amp;#039;, add type=&amp;quot;button&amp;quot; by default
  if (!as &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !(props as any).type) {
    (componentProps as any).type = &amp;#039;button&amp;#039;;
  }

  return (
    &amp;lt;Component {...componentProps}&amp;gt;
      {isLoading ? (
        &amp;lt;&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;Spinner /&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;span&amp;gt;{children}&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/&amp;gt;
      ) : (
        &amp;lt;&amp;gt;
          {iconLeft &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &amp;lt;span aria-hidden=&amp;quot;true&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{iconLeft}&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;}
          &amp;lt;span&amp;gt;{children}&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
          {iconRight &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &amp;lt;span aria-hidden=&amp;quot;true&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{iconRight}&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;}
        &amp;lt;/&amp;gt;
      )}
    &amp;lt;/Component&amp;gt;
  );
}

Button.displayName = &amp;#039;Button&amp;#039;;

// --- ICON HELPERS (Optional Export) ---
export const ArrowRightIcon = () =&amp;gt; (
  &amp;lt;svg className=&amp;quot;w-5 h-5&amp;quot; fill=&amp;quot;none&amp;quot; stroke=&amp;quot;currentColor&amp;quot; viewBox=&amp;quot;0 0 24 24&amp;quot;&amp;gt;

export const ArrowLeftIcon = () =&amp;gt; (

import { Link, usePathname } from &amp;#039;@/i18n/routing&amp;#039;;

export function Header() {
  const pathname = usePathname();
  
  // Don&amp;#039;t show UserMenu on public auth pages to avoid unnecessary API calls

  return (

      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;container mx-auto px-4 h-16 flex items-center justify-between&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;flex items-center gap-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;Link 
            href={ROUTES.DASHBOARD} 
            className=&amp;quot;flex items-center hover:opacity-80 transition-opacity&amp;quot;
            aria-label=&amp;quot;HeyGoru Home&amp;quot;
          &amp;gt;
            {/* Logo with text on desktop, logo only on mobile */}
            &amp;lt;Logo variant=&amp;quot;sm&amp;quot; showText className=&amp;quot;hidden sm:flex&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;Logo variant=&amp;quot;sm&amp;quot; className=&amp;quot;sm:hidden&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;/Link&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;flex items-center gap-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
          {!isPublicAuthPage &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &amp;lt;UserMenu /&amp;gt;}
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;/header&amp;gt;
  );
}

### `src/components/logo.tsx`

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useSystemConfig } from &amp;#039;@/features/system/queries&amp;#039;;

interface LogoProps {
  /** Size variant for different contexts */
  variant?: &amp;#039;sm&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;md&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;lg&amp;#039;;
  /** Show text next to logo */
  showText?: boolean;
  /** Optional custom className for additional styling */
  className?: string;
}

/**
 * Logo component with TanStack Query integration for system config management.
 * 
 * Architecture:
 * - Uses useSystemConfig() to retrieve logo URL (cached via TanStack Query).
 * - Falls back to process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_LOGO_URL via initialData in the hook.
 * - Maintains aggressive image performance attributes (eager, high priority).
 * - Client Component: Hydrates with data from the global QueryClient.
 */
export function Logo({ variant = &amp;#039;md&amp;#039;, showText = false, className = &amp;#039;&amp;#039; }: LogoProps) {
  const { data } = useSystemConfig();
  const logoUrl = data?.logoUrl;

  // Size mappings for different variants
  const sizeClasses = {
    sm: &amp;#039;h-8&amp;#039;,      // 32px - Mobile/compact header
    md: &amp;#039;h-10&amp;#039;,     // 40px - Desktop header
    lg: &amp;#039;h-16&amp;#039;,     // 64px - Landing page
  };

  const textSizeClasses = {
    sm: &amp;#039;text-xl&amp;#039;,
    md: &amp;#039;text-2xl&amp;#039;,
    lg: &amp;#039;text-4xl&amp;#039;,
  };

  if (!logoUrl) {
    // Fallback to text if logo not configured
    return (
      &amp;lt;span className={`font-bold text-foreground ${textSizeClasses[variant]} ${className}`}&amp;gt;
        HeyGoru
      &amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
    );
  }

  if (showText) {
    return (
      &amp;lt;div className={`flex items-center gap-3 ${className}`}&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;img
          src={logoUrl}
          alt=&amp;quot;HeyGoru Logo&amp;quot;
          className={`${sizeClasses[variant]} w-auto object-contain`}
          loading=&amp;quot;eager&amp;quot;
          fetchPriority=&amp;quot;high&amp;quot;
          decoding=&amp;quot;async&amp;quot;
        /&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;span className={`font-bold tracking-tight text-foreground ${textSizeClasses[variant]}`}&amp;gt;
          HeyGoru
        &amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
    );
  }

  return (
    &amp;lt;img
      src={logoUrl}
      alt=&amp;quot;HeyGoru Logo&amp;quot;
      className={`${sizeClasses[variant]} w-auto object-contain ${className}`}
      loading=&amp;quot;eager&amp;quot;
      fetchPriority=&amp;quot;high&amp;quot;
      decoding=&amp;quot;async&amp;quot;
    /&amp;gt;
  );
}

```

import { pgTable, bigint, varchar, text, jsonb, uniqueIndex, index } from &amp;#039;drizzle-orm/pg-core&amp;#039;;
import { users } from &amp;#039;./users&amp;#039;;
import { relations } from &amp;#039;drizzle-orm&amp;#039;;

export const accounts = pgTable(&amp;#039;accounts&amp;#039;, {
  id: bigint(&amp;#039;id&amp;#039;, { mode: &amp;#039;number&amp;#039; }).primaryKey().generatedAlwaysAsIdentity(),
  userId: bigint(&amp;#039;user_id&amp;#039;, { mode: &amp;#039;number&amp;#039; })
    .notNull()
    .references(() =&amp;gt; users.id, { onDelete: &amp;#039;cascade&amp;#039;, onUpdate: &amp;#039;no action&amp;#039; }),
  type: varchar(&amp;#039;type&amp;#039;, { length: 20 }).notNull(),
  provider: varchar(&amp;#039;provider&amp;#039;, { length: 20 }).notNull(),
  providerAccountId: varchar(&amp;#039;provider_account_id&amp;#039;, { length: 100 }).notNull(),
  refreshToken: text(&amp;#039;refresh_token&amp;#039;),
  providerMetadata: jsonb(&amp;#039;provider_metadata&amp;#039;),
}, (table) =&amp;gt; [
  uniqueIndex(&amp;#039;accounts_provider_providerAccountId_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.provider, table.providerAccountId),
  index(&amp;#039;accounts_user_id_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.userId),
]);

export const accountsRelations = relations(accounts, ({ one }) =&amp;gt; ({
  user: one(users, { fields: [accounts.userId], references: [users.id] }),
}));

  name: varchar(&amp;#039;name&amp;#039;, { length: 50 }),

  role: roleEnum(&amp;#039;role&amp;#039;).default(&amp;#039;user&amp;#039;).notNull(),
  emailVerified: timestamp(&amp;#039;email_verified&amp;#039;, { withTimezone: true, mode: &amp;#039;date&amp;#039; }),
  isBanned: boolean(&amp;#039;is_banned&amp;#039;).default(false).notNull(),
  
  createdAt: timestamp(&amp;#039;created_at&amp;#039;, { withTimezone: true, mode: &amp;#039;date&amp;#039; }).defaultNow().notNull(),
  updatedAt: timestamp(&amp;#039;updated_at&amp;#039;, { withTimezone: true, mode: &amp;#039;date&amp;#039; }).defaultNow().notNull(),
}, (table) =&amp;gt; [
  // Index thÆ°á»ng (Sáº½ nÃ¢ng cáº¥p lÃªn Covering Index báº±ng SQL thá»§ cÃ´ng)
  uniqueIndex(&amp;#039;users_email_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.email),
  uniqueIndex(&amp;#039;users_username_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.username),
  uniqueIndex(&amp;#039;users_public_id_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.publicId),
  
  // Partial Index
  index(&amp;#039;users_is_banned_idx&amp;#039;).on(table.isBanned).where(sql`${table.isBanned} IS TRUE`),
]);

export const usersRelations = relations(users, ({ one, many }) =&amp;gt; ({
  profile: one(userProfiles, { fields: [users.id], references: [userProfiles.userId] }),
  secret: one(userSecrets, { fields: [users.id], references: [userSecrets.userId] }),
  accounts: many(accounts),
  sessions: many(sessions),
}));

### `src/features/account/general/actions.ts`

```ts
&amp;#039;use server&amp;#039;;

import { db } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-ws&amp;#039;;
import { sql, db as dbHttp } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-http&amp;#039;;
import { users, userProfiles, sessions } from &amp;#039;@/db/drizzle&amp;#039;;
import { eq } from &amp;#039;drizzle-orm&amp;#039;;
import { getSessionCookie } from &amp;#039;@/utils/cookies&amp;#039;;
import { revalidatePath } from &amp;#039;next/cache&amp;#039;;
import { insertUserSchema } from &amp;#039;@/db/zod/users&amp;#039;;
import { insertUserProfileSchema } from &amp;#039;@/db/zod/user_profiles&amp;#039;;
import type { GeneralProfile, UpdateGeneralPayload } from &amp;#039;./types&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Get general profile data (HTTP - simple read)
 */
export async function getGeneralProfile(): Promise&amp;lt;GeneralProfile | null&amp;gt; {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) return null;

  // Optimized query selecting only necessary fields
  const result = await sql`
    SELECT 
      u.id, u.email, u.name, u.username, u.image,
      up.bio, up.username_last_changed
    FROM users u
    LEFT JOIN user_profiles up ON up.user_id = u.id
    JOIN sessions s ON s.user_id = u.id
    WHERE s.session_token = ${sessionToken}
    LIMIT 1
  `;

  if (!result[0]) return null;

  return {
    id: result[0].id,
    email: result[0].email,
    name: result[0].name,
    username: result[0].username,
    image: result[0].image,
    bio: result[0].bio || null,
    usernameLastChanged: result[0].username_last_changed ? new Date(result[0].username_last_changed) : null,
  };
}

/**
 * Update general profile (name, bio) - only update changed fields
 */
export async function updateGeneralProfile(payload: UpdateGeneralPayload) {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Not authenticated&amp;#039; };
  }

  // Validate payload using Zod schemas
  if (payload.name !== undefined) {
    const nameValidation = insertUserSchema.pick({ name: true }).safeParse({ name: payload.name });
    if (!nameValidation.success) {
      return { success: false, error: nameValidation.error.issues[0].message };
    }
  }

  if (payload.bio !== undefined) {
    const bioValidation = insertUserProfileSchema.pick({ bio: true }).safeParse({ bio: payload.bio });
    if (!bioValidation.success) {
      return { success: false, error: bioValidation.error.issues[0].message };
    }
  }

  try {
    // Use HTTP driver for read checks (faster)
    const session = await dbHttp.query.sessions.findFirst({
      where: eq(sessions.sessionToken, sessionToken),
      columns: { userId: true },
    });

    if (!session) {
      return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Session not found&amp;#039; };
    }

    const updates: Promise&amp;lt;unknown&amp;gt;[] = [];

    // Update User table (name)
    if (payload.name !== undefined) {
      updates.push(
        db
          .update(users)
          .set({ name: payload.name, updatedAt: new Date() })
          .where(eq(users.id, session.userId))
      );
    }

    // Update UserProfile table (bio)
    if (payload.bio !== undefined) {
      // Check if profile exists first to decide Insert vs Update
      // We can use ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE if supported, but separate check is safer for logic
      // Check if profile exists first (Read -&amp;gt; HTTP)
      const profileExists = await dbHttp.query.userProfiles.findFirst({
        where: eq(userProfiles.userId, session.userId),
        columns: { userId: true },
      });

      if (!profileExists) {
        updates.push(
          db.insert(userProfiles).values({
            userId: session.userId,
            bio: payload.bio,
            updatedAt: new Date(),
          })
        );
      } else {
        updates.push(
          db
            .update(userProfiles)
            .set({ bio: payload.bio, updatedAt: new Date() })
            .where(eq(userProfiles.userId, session.userId))
        );
      }
    }

    await Promise.all(updates);

    revalidatePath(&amp;#039;/account&amp;#039;);
    return { success: true };
  } catch (error) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Update failed&amp;#039; };
  }
}

/**
 * Update username with 90-day restriction
 */
export async function updateUsername(formData: FormData) {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Not authenticated&amp;#039; };
  }

  const username = formData.get(&amp;#039;username&amp;#039;) as string;
  
  // Validate username format
  const usernameRegex = /^[a-z0-9_]{3,20}$/;
  if (!usernameRegex.test(username)) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Username khÃ´ng há»£p lá»‡ (3-20 kÃ½ tá»±, chá»¯ thÆ°á»ng, sá»‘, gáº¡ch dÆ°á»›i)&amp;#039; };
  }

  try {
    const session = await dbHttp.query.sessions.findFirst({
      where: eq(sessions.sessionToken, sessionToken),
      with: {
        user: {
          with: { profile: true },
        },
      },
    });

    if (!session) {
      return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Session not found&amp;#039; };
    }

    // Check 90-day restriction
    const lastChanged = session.user.profile?.usernameLastChanged;
    if (lastChanged) {
      const daysSinceChange = (Date.now() - lastChanged.getTime()) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24);
      if (daysSinceChange &amp;lt; 90) {
        const daysRemaining = Math.ceil(90 - daysSinceChange);
        return { 
          success: false, 
          error: `Báº¡n chá»‰ cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘á»•i username sau ${daysRemaining} ngÃ y ná»¯a` 
        };
      }
    }

    // Check uniqueness (using HTTP driver for read check is faster)
    const existing = await dbHttp.query.users.findFirst({
      where: (users, { eq, and, ne }) =&amp;gt; and(
        eq(users.username, username),
        ne(users.id, session.user.id)
      ),
    });

    if (existing) {
      return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Username Ä‘Ã£ Ä‘Æ°á»£c sá»­ dá»¥ng&amp;#039; };
    }

    // Update User and Profile
    await db.transaction(async (tx) =&amp;gt; {
      await tx
        .update(users)
        .set({ username, updatedAt: new Date() })
        .where(eq(users.id, session.user.id));

      // Ensure profile exists
      if (session.user.profile) {
        await tx
          .update(userProfiles)
          .set({ usernameLastChanged: new Date(), updatedAt: new Date() })
          .where(eq(userProfiles.userId, session.user.id));
      } else {
        await tx.insert(userProfiles).values({
          userId: session.user.id,
          usernameLastChanged: new Date(),
          updatedAt: new Date(),
        });
      }
    });

    revalidatePath(&amp;#039;/account&amp;#039;);
    return { success: true };
  } catch (error) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Update failed&amp;#039; };
  }
}

```

### `src/features/account/general/components/avatar-editor.tsx`

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useState, useRef } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;
import { useMutation } from &amp;#039;@tanstack/react-query&amp;#039;;
import { uploadAvatar, removeAvatar } from &amp;#039;@/features/storage/actions&amp;#039;;
import { useAvatarSync } from &amp;#039;@/features/storage/hooks&amp;#039;;
import { useTranslations } from &amp;#039;next-intl&amp;#039;;
import { toast } from &amp;#039;sonner&amp;#039;;
import { Button } from &amp;#039;@/components/button&amp;#039;;
import { ImageCropper } from &amp;#039;@/features/image-processing/components/image-cropper&amp;#039;;
import { processImage } from &amp;#039;@/features/image-processing&amp;#039;;
import { PencilIcon, ImageIcon, TrashIcon } from &amp;#039;@/components/icons&amp;#039;;

interface Props {
  currentImage: string | null;
}

export function AvatarEditor({ currentImage }: Props) {
  const t = useTranslations(&amp;#039;account.general.avatar&amp;#039;);
  const [isOpen, setIsOpen] = useState(false);
  const [isCropperOpen, setIsCropperOpen] = useState(false);
  const [selectedFile, setSelectedFile] = useState&amp;lt;File | null&amp;gt;(null);
  const { syncAvatarUpdate } = useAvatarSync();
  const fileInputRef = useRef&amp;lt;HTMLInputElement&amp;gt;(null);

  const uploadMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (file: File | Blob) =&amp;gt; {
      const formData = new FormData();
      formData.append(&amp;#039;file&amp;#039;, file);
      const result = await uploadAvatar(formData);
      if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
      return result;
    },
    onSuccess: (data) =&amp;gt; {
      if (data.url) {
        syncAvatarUpdate(data.url);
      }
      setIsOpen(false);
      toast.success(t(&amp;#039;success.upload&amp;#039;));
    },
    onError: (error) =&amp;gt; {
      // Map error codes to translation keys using switch-case
      // next-intl requires static keys, cannot use dynamic template literals
      let errorMessage: string;
      
      switch (error.message) {
        case &amp;#039;fileTooLarge&amp;#039;:
          errorMessage = t(&amp;#039;errors.fileTooLarge&amp;#039;);
          break;
        case &amp;#039;invalidFileType&amp;#039;:
          errorMessage = t(&amp;#039;errors.invalidFileType&amp;#039;);
          break;
        case &amp;#039;noFile&amp;#039;:
          errorMessage = t(&amp;#039;errors.noFile&amp;#039;);
          break;
        case &amp;#039;unauthorized&amp;#039;:
          errorMessage = t(&amp;#039;errors.unauthorized&amp;#039;);
          break;
        default:
          errorMessage = t(&amp;#039;errors.uploadFailed&amp;#039;);
      }
      
      toast.error(errorMessage);
    },
  });

  const removeMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async () =&amp;gt; {
      const result = await removeAvatar();
      if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
      return result;
    },
    onSuccess: () =&amp;gt; {
      syncAvatarUpdate(null);
      setIsOpen(false);
      toast.success(t(&amp;#039;success.remove&amp;#039;));
    },
    onError: (error) =&amp;gt; {
      toast.error(error.message);
    },
  });

  function handleFileSelect() {
    fileInputRef.current?.click();
  }

  function handleFileChange(e: React.ChangeEvent&amp;lt;HTMLInputElement&amp;gt;) {
    const file = e.target.files?.[0];
    if (!file) return;

    // NO VALIDATION - Open cropper immediately
    setSelectedFile(file);
    setIsCropperOpen(true);
    e.target.value = &amp;#039;&amp;#039;;
  }

  async function handleCropConfirm(croppedBlob: Blob) {
    try {
      setIsCropperOpen(false);
      setSelectedFile(null);
      
      // Process image (compress to WebP)
      const processed = await processImage(croppedBlob, {
        maxWidth: 256,
        maxHeight: 256,
        outputFormat: &amp;#039;image/webp&amp;#039;,
        quality: 0.3,
      });

      // Upload the processed blob - server will validate size
      uploadMutation.mutate(processed.blob);
    } catch (error) {
      toast.error(t(&amp;#039;errors.uploadFailed&amp;#039;));
    }
  }

  function handleCropCancel() {
    setIsCropperOpen(false);
    setSelectedFile(null);
  }

  const displayImage = currentImage || process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_DEFAULT_AVATAR_URL;

  return (
    &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;relative&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;input
        type=&amp;quot;file&amp;quot;
        ref={fileInputRef}
        className=&amp;quot;hidden&amp;quot;
        accept=&amp;quot;image/jpeg,image/jpg,image/png,image/webp,image/gif,image/bmp,image/*&amp;quot;
        onChange={handleFileChange}
      /&amp;gt;

      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;w-24 h-24 rounded-full overflow-hidden ring-2 ring-border bg-muted&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
        {displayImage ? (
          &amp;lt;img
            src={displayImage}
            alt=&amp;quot;Avatar&amp;quot;
            className=&amp;quot;w-full h-full object-cover&amp;quot;
            loading=&amp;quot;lazy&amp;quot;
          /&amp;gt;
        ) : (
          &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;w-full h-full flex items-center justify-center text-3xl font-bold text-muted-foreground&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
            ?
          &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        )}
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;

      &amp;lt;button
        type=&amp;quot;button&amp;quot;
        onClick={() =&amp;gt; setIsOpen(!isOpen)}
        className=&amp;quot;absolute bottom-0 right-0 w-8 h-8 bg-primary text-primary-foreground rounded-full flex items-center justify-center hover:scale-105 transition-all cursor-pointer focus:outline-none focus:ring-2 focus:ring-ring focus:ring-offset-2 shadow-md&amp;quot;
        aria-label={t(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;)}
      &amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;PencilIcon className=&amp;quot;w-4 h-4&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/button&amp;gt;

      {/* Modal */}
      {isOpen &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
        &amp;lt;div
          className=&amp;quot;fixed inset-0 z-50 flex items-center justify-center bg-foreground/50 backdrop-blur-sm cursor-pointer&amp;quot;
          onClick={() =&amp;gt; setIsOpen(false)}
        &amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;div
            className=&amp;quot;bg-card border border-border rounded-xl p-6 max-w-sm w-full mx-4 shadow-xl cursor-default&amp;quot;
            onClick={(e) =&amp;gt; e.stopPropagation()}
          &amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;h3 className=&amp;quot;text-lg font-semibold text-foreground mb-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
              {t(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;)}
            &amp;lt;/h3&amp;gt;

            &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;space-y-3&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
              &amp;lt;Button
                onClick={handleFileSelect}
                isLoading={uploadMutation.isPending}
                variant=&amp;quot;primary&amp;quot;
                fullWidth
                className=&amp;quot;justify-start&amp;quot;
                iconLeft={!uploadMutation.isPending &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &amp;lt;ImageIcon className=&amp;quot;w-5 h-5&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;}
              &amp;gt;
                {uploadMutation.isPending ? t(&amp;#039;uploading&amp;#039;) : t(&amp;#039;upload&amp;#039;)}
              &amp;lt;/Button&amp;gt;

              {currentImage &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
                &amp;lt;Button
                  onClick={() =&amp;gt; removeMutation.mutate()}
                  isLoading={removeMutation.isPending}
                  disabled={uploadMutation.isPending}
                  variant=&amp;quot;ghost&amp;quot;
                  fullWidth
                  className=&amp;quot;justify-start text-muted-foreground hover:text-foreground&amp;quot;
                  iconLeft={!removeMutation.isPending &amp;amp;&amp;amp; &amp;lt;TrashIcon className=&amp;quot;w-5 h-5&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;}
                &amp;gt;
                  {removeMutation.isPending ? t(&amp;#039;removing&amp;#039;) : t(&amp;#039;remove&amp;#039;)}
                &amp;lt;/Button&amp;gt;
              )}

              &amp;lt;Button
                onClick={() =&amp;gt; setIsOpen(false)}
                variant=&amp;quot;secondary&amp;quot;
                fullWidth
              &amp;gt;
                {t(&amp;#039;cancel&amp;#039;)}
              &amp;lt;/Button&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;

            {uploadMutation.error &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
              &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-error mt-3&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
                {(() =&amp;gt; {
                  // Map error code to translation using switch-case
                  switch (uploadMutation.error.message) {
                    case &amp;#039;fileTooLarge&amp;#039;:
                      return t(&amp;#039;errors.fileTooLarge&amp;#039;);
                    case &amp;#039;invalidFileType&amp;#039;:
                      return t(&amp;#039;errors.invalidFileType&amp;#039;);
                    case &amp;#039;noFile&amp;#039;:
                      return t(&amp;#039;errors.noFile&amp;#039;);
                    case &amp;#039;unauthorized&amp;#039;:
                      return t(&amp;#039;errors.unauthorized&amp;#039;);
                    default:
                      return t(&amp;#039;errors.uploadFailed&amp;#039;);
                  }
                })()}
              &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
            )}
            {removeMutation.error &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
              &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-error mt-3&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{removeMutation.error.message}&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
            )}
          &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
      )}

      {/* Image Cropper Modal */}
      {selectedFile &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
        &amp;lt;ImageCropper
          file={selectedFile}
          aspectRatio={1} // 1:1 square for avatar
          onConfirm={handleCropConfirm}
          onCancel={handleCropCancel}
          isOpen={isCropperOpen}
        /&amp;gt;
      )}
    &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
  );
}

  });

  // Sync form data with profile when loaded or editing starts
  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    if (profile) {
      setFormData({

        bio: profile.bio || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
        username: profile.username || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
      });
    }
  }, [profile, isEditing]);

  const updateGeneralMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (payload: UpdateGeneralPayload) =&amp;gt; {
      const result = await updateGeneralProfile(payload);
      if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
      return result;
    },
    onMutate: async (newData) =&amp;gt; {
      await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: accountGeneralQueries.profile() });
      const previous = queryClient.getQueryData(accountGeneralQueries.profile());
      queryClient.setQueryData(accountGeneralQueries.profile(), (old: GeneralProfile | undefined) =&amp;gt; {
        if (!old) return old;
        return { ...old, ...newData };
      });
      return { previous };
    },
    onError: (_err, _newData, context) =&amp;gt; {
      if (context?.previous) {
        queryClient.setQueryData(accountGeneralQueries.profile(), context.previous);
      }
    },
    onSettled: () =&amp;gt; {
      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: accountGeneralQueries.profile() });
    },
  });

  const updateUsernameMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (newUsername: string) =&amp;gt; {
      const formData = new FormData();
      formData.set(&amp;#039;username&amp;#039;, newUsername);
      const result = await updateUsername(formData);
      if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
      return result;
    },
    onSuccess: () =&amp;gt; {
      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: accountGeneralQueries.profile() });
    },
  });

  // Calculate dirty state
  const isNameBioDirty = profile ? (formData.name !== (profile.name || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;) || formData.bio !== (profile.bio || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;)) : false;
  const isUsernameDirty = profile ? (formData.username !== (profile.username || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;)) : false;
  const isDirty = isNameBioDirty || isUsernameDirty;
  const isPending = updateGeneralMutation.isPending || updateUsernameMutation.isPending;

  // Calculate username change eligibility
  let daysUntilChange: number | null = null;
  if (profile?.usernameLastChanged) {

  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {

  if (isLoading) {

      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
    );
  }

  if (!profile) return null;

  return (
    &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;space-y-8&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
      {/* Profile Header &amp;amp; Basic Info */}

        {/* Left: Avatar */}

                  &amp;lt;h2 className=&amp;quot;text-2xl font-bold text-foreground&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{profile.name || &amp;#039;ChÆ°a Ä‘áº·t tÃªn&amp;#039;}&amp;lt;/h2&amp;gt;
                  &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;text-muted-foreground flex flex-col sm:flex-row sm:items-center gap-1 sm:gap-2 mt-1&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
                    &amp;lt;span className=&amp;quot;font-medium&amp;quot;&amp;gt;@{profile.username || &amp;#039;username&amp;#039;}&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;
                    &amp;lt;span className=&amp;quot;hidden sm:inline&amp;quot;&amp;gt;â€¢&amp;lt;/span&amp;gt;

              &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
              
               {updateGeneralMutation.error &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
                &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-error&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{updateGeneralMutation.error.message}&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
              )}
               {updateUsernameMutation.error &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
                &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-error&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{updateUsernameMutation.error.message}&amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
              )}

      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;border-t border-border my-6&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;

      {/* Theme Selection */}
      &amp;lt;div&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;mb-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;h3 className=&amp;quot;text-lg font-semibold text-foreground&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{tTheme(&amp;#039;title&amp;#039;)}&amp;lt;/h3&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-1&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
            {tTheme(&amp;#039;description&amp;#039;)}
          &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;ThemeSelector /&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;

      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;border-t border-border my-6&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;

      {/* Language Selection */}
      &amp;lt;div&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;mb-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;h3 className=&amp;quot;text-lg font-semibold text-foreground&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{tLang(&amp;#039;title&amp;#039;)}&amp;lt;/h3&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-1&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
            {tLang(&amp;#039;description&amp;#039;)}
          &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;LanguageSwitcher /&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
  );
}

### `src/features/account/general/components/theme-selector.tsx`

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useEffect, useState } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

type Theme = &amp;#039;light&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;system&amp;#039;;

import { useTranslations } from &amp;#039;next-intl&amp;#039;;

export function ThemeSelector() {
  const t = useTranslations(&amp;#039;common.theme&amp;#039;);
  const [theme, setTheme] = useState&amp;lt;Theme&amp;gt;(&amp;#039;system&amp;#039;);
  const [mounted, setMounted] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    setMounted(true);
    const stored = localStorage.getItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;) as Theme | null;
    if (stored === &amp;#039;light&amp;#039; || stored === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;) {
      setTheme(stored);
    } else {
      setTheme(&amp;#039;system&amp;#039;);
    }

    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&amp;#039;);
    const handleChange = () =&amp;gt; {
      const currentStored = localStorage.getItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;);
      if (!currentStored) { // System mode
        if (mediaQuery.matches) {
          document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
        } else {
          document.documentElement.classList.remove(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
        }
      }
    };

    mediaQuery.addEventListener(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;, handleChange);
    return () =&amp;gt; mediaQuery.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;, handleChange);
  }, []);

  const updateTheme = (newTheme: Theme) =&amp;gt; {
    setTheme(newTheme);
    
    if (newTheme === &amp;#039;system&amp;#039;) {
      localStorage.removeItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;);
      if (window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&amp;#039;).matches) {
        document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
      } else {
        document.documentElement.classList.remove(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
      }
    } else {
      localStorage.setItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;, newTheme);
      if (newTheme === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;) {
        document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
      } else {
        document.documentElement.classList.remove(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
      }
    }
  };

  if (!mounted) {
    return &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;h-[100px] bg-muted/20 animate-pulse rounded-lg&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;;
  }

  return (
    &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;grid grid-cols-1 sm:grid-cols-3 gap-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;button
        onClick={() =&amp;gt; updateTheme(&amp;#039;light&amp;#039;)}
        className={`
          relative flex flex-col items-center gap-3 p-4 rounded-xl border-2 transition-all cursor-pointer focus-visible:outline-none focus-visible:ring-2 focus-visible:ring-ring focus-visible:ring-offset-2
          ${theme === &amp;#039;light&amp;#039; 
            ? &amp;#039;border-primary bg-primary/5&amp;#039; 
            : &amp;#039;border-border hover:border-primary/50 hover:bg-muted/50&amp;#039;
          }
        `}
      &amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className={`p-3 rounded-full ${theme === &amp;#039;light&amp;#039; ? &amp;#039;bg-primary/10 text-primary&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;bg-muted text-muted-foreground&amp;#039;}`}&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;svg xmlns=&amp;quot;http://www.w3.org/2000/svg&amp;quot; width=&amp;quot;24&amp;quot; height=&amp;quot;24&amp;quot; viewBox=&amp;quot;0 0 24 24&amp;quot; fill=&amp;quot;none&amp;quot; stroke=&amp;quot;currentColor&amp;quot; strokeWidth=&amp;quot;2&amp;quot; strokeLinecap=&amp;quot;round&amp;quot; strokeLinejoin=&amp;quot;round&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;circle cx=&amp;quot;12&amp;quot; cy=&amp;quot;12&amp;quot; r=&amp;quot;4&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;path d=&amp;quot;M12 2v2&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;path d=&amp;quot;M12 20v2&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;

export function UsernameEditor({ currentUsername, usernameLastChanged }: Props) {
  const queryClient = useQueryClient();

  const [username, setUsername] = useState(currentUsername || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;);

      const formData = new FormData();

### `src/features/account/profile/actions.ts`

```ts
&amp;#039;use server&amp;#039;;

import { db } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-ws&amp;#039;;
import { sql, db as dbHttp } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-http&amp;#039;;
import { userProfiles, sessions } from &amp;#039;@/db/drizzle&amp;#039;;
import { eq } from &amp;#039;drizzle-orm&amp;#039;;
import { getSessionCookie } from &amp;#039;@/utils/cookies&amp;#039;;
import { revalidatePath } from &amp;#039;next/cache&amp;#039;;
import { insertUserProfileSchema } from &amp;#039;@/db/zod/user_profiles&amp;#039;;
import type { ProfileData, UpdateProfilePayload } from &amp;#039;@/features/account/profile/types&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Get profile preferences data (HTTP - simple read)
 */
export async function getProfileData(): Promise&amp;lt;ProfileData | null&amp;gt; {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) return null;

  const result = await sql`
    SELECT 
      up.date_of_birth, up.gender, up.preferences
    FROM user_profiles up
    JOIN sessions s ON s.user_id = up.user_id
    WHERE s.session_token = ${sessionToken}
    LIMIT 1
  `;

  if (!result[0]) {
    // Return default values if profile doesn&amp;#039;t exist
    return {
      dateOfBirth: null,
      gender: &amp;#039;hidden&amp;#039;,
      preferences: {},
    };
  }

  return {
    dateOfBirth: result[0].date_of_birth,
    gender: result[0].gender || &amp;#039;hidden&amp;#039;,
    preferences: (result[0].preferences as any) || {},
  };
}

/**
 * Update profile preferences - only update changed fields
 */
export async function updateProfileData(payload: UpdateProfilePayload) {
  const sessionToken = await getSessionCookie();
  if (!sessionToken) {
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Not authenticated&amp;#039; };
  }

  // Validate basic fields using Zod
  if (payload.gender) {
    const genderValidation = insertUserProfileSchema.pick({ gender: true }).safeParse({ gender: payload.gender });
    if (!genderValidation.success) {
      return { success: false, error: genderValidation.error.issues[0].message };
    }
  }

  try {
    const session = await dbHttp.query.sessions.findFirst({
      where: eq(sessions.sessionToken, sessionToken),
      columns: { userId: true },
    });

    if (!session) {
      return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Session not found&amp;#039; };
    }

    // Check if profile exists (Read -&amp;gt; HTTP)
    const profile = await dbHttp.query.userProfiles.findFirst({
      where: eq(userProfiles.userId, session.userId),
    });

    // Prepare update data
    const updateData: any = {
      updatedAt: new Date(),
    };

    if (payload.dateOfBirth !== undefined) {
      updateData.dateOfBirth = payload.dateOfBirth;
    }

    if (payload.gender !== undefined) {
      updateData.gender = payload.gender;
    }

    // Handle preferences updates (merge with existing)
    if (payload.language !== undefined || payload.theme !== undefined) {
      const currentPrefs = (profile?.preferences as Record&amp;lt;string, unknown&amp;gt;) || {};
      const newPrefs = { ...currentPrefs };

      if (payload.language !== undefined) {
        newPrefs.language = payload.language;
      }

      if (payload.theme !== undefined) {
        newPrefs.theme = payload.theme;
      }

      updateData.preferences = newPrefs;
    }

    if (!profile) {
      // Create profile if doesn&amp;#039;t exist
      await db.insert(userProfiles).values({
        userId: session.userId,
        ...updateData,
      });
    } else {
      // Update existing profile
      await db
        .update(userProfiles)
        .set(updateData)
        .where(eq(userProfiles.userId, session.userId));
    }

    revalidatePath(&amp;#039;/account&amp;#039;);
    return { success: true };
  } catch (error) {
    console.error(&amp;#039;Update profile data error:&amp;#039;, error);
    return { success: false, error: &amp;#039;Update failed&amp;#039; };
  }
}

import { useQuery, useMutation, useQueryClient } from &amp;#039;@tanstack/react-query&amp;#039;;
import { useState, useEffect } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;
import { accountProfileQueries } from &amp;#039;@/features/account/profile/queries&amp;#039;;
import { getProfileData, updateProfileData } from &amp;#039;@/features/account/profile/actions&amp;#039;;
import type { UpdateProfilePayload, ProfileData } from &amp;#039;@/features/account/profile/types&amp;#039;;
import { GENDERS } from &amp;#039;@/db/drizzle/_enums&amp;#039;;
import { Button } from &amp;#039;@/components/button&amp;#039;;

import { useTranslations, useFormatter } from &amp;#039;next-intl&amp;#039;;

export function ProfileDataSection() {
  const t = useTranslations(&amp;#039;account.profile&amp;#039;);
  const format = useFormatter();
  const queryClient = useQueryClient();
  const [isEditing, setIsEditing] = useState(false);
  const [formData, setFormData] = useState({
    dateOfBirth: &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
    gender: &amp;#039;hidden&amp;#039;,
    language: &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;,
  });

  const { data: profileData, isLoading } = useQuery({
    queryKey: accountProfileQueries.data(),
    queryFn: getProfileData,
    staleTime: 1000 * 60 * 5,       // 5 minutes - data considered fresh
    gcTime: 1000 * 60 * 10,         // 10 minutes - keep in cache longer
    refetchOnMount: false,           // Don&amp;#039;t refetch on mount if data is fresh
    refetchOnWindowFocus: false,     // Don&amp;#039;t refetch when returning to tab
    refetchOnReconnect: false,       // Don&amp;#039;t refetch on network reconnect
  });

  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    if (profileData) {
      setFormData({
        dateOfBirth: profileData.dateOfBirth || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
        gender: profileData.gender || &amp;#039;hidden&amp;#039;,
        language: profileData.preferences?.language || &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;,
      });
    }
  }, [profileData, isEditing]);

  const updateMutation = useMutation({
    mutationFn: async (payload: UpdateProfilePayload) =&amp;gt; {
      const result = await updateProfileData(payload);
      if (!result.success) throw new Error(result.error);
      return result;
    },
    onMutate: async (newData) =&amp;gt; {
      await queryClient.cancelQueries({ queryKey: accountProfileQueries.data() });
      const previous = queryClient.getQueryData(accountProfileQueries.data());

      queryClient.setQueryData(accountProfileQueries.data(), (old: ProfileData | undefined) =&amp;gt; {
        if (!old) return old;
        return {
          ...old,
          ...(newData.dateOfBirth !== undefined &amp;amp;&amp;amp; { dateOfBirth: newData.dateOfBirth }),
          ...(newData.gender !== undefined &amp;amp;&amp;amp; { gender: newData.gender }),
          preferences: {
            ...old.preferences,
            ...(newData.language !== undefined &amp;amp;&amp;amp; { language: newData.language }),
          },
        };
      });

      return { previous };
    },
    onError: (_err, _newData, context) =&amp;gt; {
      if (context?.previous) {
        queryClient.setQueryData(accountProfileQueries.data(), context.previous);
      }
    },
    onSettled: () =&amp;gt; {
      queryClient.invalidateQueries({ queryKey: accountProfileQueries.data() });
    },
  });

  const isDirty = profileData ? (
    formData.dateOfBirth !== (profileData.dateOfBirth || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;) ||
    formData.gender !== (profileData.gender || &amp;#039;hidden&amp;#039;) ||
    formData.language !== (profileData.preferences?.language || &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;)
  ) : false;

  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent&amp;lt;HTMLFormElement&amp;gt;) {
    e.preventDefault();
    if (!isDirty) return;

    const payload: UpdateProfilePayload = {};

    // Only include changed fields
    if (formData.dateOfBirth !== (profileData?.dateOfBirth || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;)) {
      payload.dateOfBirth = formData.dateOfBirth || null;
    }
    if (formData.gender !== profileData?.gender) {
      payload.gender = formData.gender as any;
    }
    if (formData.language !== (profileData?.preferences?.language || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;)) {
      payload.language = formData.language;
    }

    await updateMutation.mutateAsync(payload);
    setIsEditing(false);
  }

  if (isLoading) {
    return (
      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;animate-pulse space-y-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;h-12 bg-muted rounded-lg&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;h-12 bg-muted rounded-lg&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;h-12 bg-muted rounded-lg&amp;quot; /&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
    );
  }

  if (!profileData) return null;

  const displayData = profileData;

  return (
    &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;space-y-6&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
      &amp;lt;div className=&amp;quot;flex items-center justify-between&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;div&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;h3 className=&amp;quot;text-lg font-semibold text-foreground&amp;quot;&amp;gt;{t(&amp;#039;title&amp;#039;)}&amp;lt;/h3&amp;gt;
          &amp;lt;p className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-muted-foreground mt-1&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
            {t(&amp;#039;description&amp;#039;)}
          &amp;lt;/p&amp;gt;
        &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;
        {!isEditing &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (
          &amp;lt;Button
            onClick={() =&amp;gt; setIsEditing(true)}
            variant=&amp;quot;ghost&amp;quot;
            size=&amp;quot;sm&amp;quot;
            className=&amp;quot;text-sm text-primary hover:text-primary hover:bg-primary/10 h-auto py-1 px-3&amp;quot;
          &amp;gt;
            {t(&amp;#039;actions.edit&amp;#039;)}
          &amp;lt;/Button&amp;gt;
        )}
      &amp;lt;/div&amp;gt;

      {isEditing ? (
        &amp;lt;form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className=&amp;quot;space-y-4&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
          {/* Date of Birth */}
          &amp;lt;div&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;label htmlFor=&amp;quot;dateOfBirth&amp;quot; className=&amp;quot;block text-sm font-medium text-foreground mb-2&amp;quot;&amp;gt;
              {t(&amp;#039;dateOfBirth.label&amp;#039;)}
            &amp;lt;/label&amp;gt;
            &amp;lt;input
