```ts
import { ImageCropArea } from &amp;#039;../types&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Load image from file/blob
 * Note: In a Worker, we might need to use ImageBitmap
 */
export const loadImage = async (file: File | Blob): Promise&amp;lt;HTMLImageElement | ImageBitmap&amp;gt; =&amp;gt; {
  if (typeof createImageBitmap !== &amp;#039;undefined&amp;#039;) {
    return createImageBitmap(file);
  }
  
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&amp;gt; {
    const img = new Image();
    const url = URL.createObjectURL(file);
    const cleanup = () =&amp;gt; URL.revokeObjectURL(url);

    img.onload = () =&amp;gt; {
      cleanup();
      resolve(img);
    };

    img.onerror = () =&amp;gt; {
      cleanup();
      reject(new Error(&amp;quot;Failed to load image&amp;quot;));
    };

    img.src = url;
  });
};

/**
 * Create a canvas (or OffscreenCanvas) with the target image drawn on it.
 */
export const createCanvas = (
  img: HTMLImageElement | ImageBitmap,
  targetWidth: number,
  targetHeight: number,
  cropArea?: ImageCropArea,
  hasTransparency: boolean = false,
  imageType: string = &amp;#039;photo&amp;#039;
): HTMLCanvasElement | OffscreenCanvas =&amp;gt; {
  let canvas: HTMLCanvasElement | OffscreenCanvas;
  let ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D | OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D | null;

  if (typeof OffscreenCanvas !== &amp;#039;undefined&amp;#039;) {
    canvas = new OffscreenCanvas(targetWidth, targetHeight);
    ctx = canvas.getContext(&amp;quot;2d&amp;quot;, {
      alpha: hasTransparency,
      desynchronized: true,
      willReadFrequently: false,
    }) as OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D;
  } else {
    canvas = document.createElement(&amp;quot;canvas&amp;quot;);
    canvas.width = targetWidth;
    canvas.height = targetHeight;
    ctx = canvas.getContext(&amp;quot;2d&amp;quot;, {
      alpha: hasTransparency,
      desynchronized: true,
      willReadFrequently: false,
    });
  }

  if (!ctx) throw new Error(&amp;quot;Could not get canvas context&amp;quot;);

  ctx.imageSmoothingEnabled = true;
  ctx.imageSmoothingQuality = imageType === &amp;quot;graphic&amp;quot; ? &amp;quot;high&amp;quot; : &amp;quot;medium&amp;quot;;

  if (cropArea) {
    drawWithManualCrop(ctx, img, cropArea, targetWidth, targetHeight);
  } else {
    drawWithSmartCrop(ctx, img, targetWidth, targetHeight);
  }

  // Apply mild sharpening for downscaled photos
  if (imageType === &amp;quot;photo&amp;quot; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; (targetWidth &amp;lt; img.width * 0.7)) {
    applySharpen(ctx, targetWidth, targetHeight, 0.3);
  }

  return canvas;
};

const drawWithManualCrop = (
  ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D | OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D,
  img: HTMLImageElement | ImageBitmap,
  crop: ImageCropArea,
  targetWidth: number,
  targetHeight: number
) =&amp;gt; {
  ctx.drawImage(
    img,
    crop.x, crop.y, crop.width, crop.height,
    0, 0, targetWidth, targetHeight
  );
};

const drawWithSmartCrop = (
  ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D | OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D,
  img: HTMLImageElement | ImageBitmap,
  targetWidth: number,
  targetHeight: number
) =&amp;gt; {
  const sourceWidth = img.width;
  const sourceHeight = img.height;
  const sourceAspect = sourceWidth / sourceHeight;
  const targetAspect = targetWidth / targetHeight;

  let sx = 0, sy = 0, sw = sourceWidth, sh = sourceHeight;

  if (sourceAspect &amp;gt; targetAspect) {
    sw = sourceHeight * targetAspect;
    sx = (sourceWidth - sw) / 2;
  } else if (sourceAspect &amp;lt; targetAspect) {
    sh = sourceWidth / targetAspect;
    sy = (sourceHeight - sh) / 2;
  }

  ctx.drawImage(img, sx, sy, sw, sh, 0, 0, targetWidth, targetHeight);
};

const applySharpen = (ctx: CanvasRenderingContext2D | OffscreenCanvasRenderingContext2D, width: number, height: number, strength: number) =&amp;gt; {
  try {
    const imageData = ctx.getImageData(0, 0, width, height);
    const data = imageData.data;
    const output = new Uint8ClampedArray(data);

    for (let y = 1; y &amp;lt; height - 1; y++) {
      for (let x = 1; x &amp;lt; width - 1; x++) {
        const i = (y * width + x) * 4;
        for (let c = 0; c &amp;lt; 3; c++) {
          const current = data[i + c];
          const neighbors =
            (data[i - 4 + c] +
              data[i + 4 + c] +
              data[i - width * 4 + c] +
              data[i + width * 4 + c]) / 4;
          output[i + c] = Math.min(255, Math.max(0, current + (current - neighbors) * strength));
        }
      }
    }
    imageData.data.set(output);
    ctx.putImageData(imageData, 0, 0);
  } catch (e) {
    // Ignore errors
  }
};

export const canvasToBlob = async (canvas: HTMLCanvasElement | OffscreenCanvas, mimeType: string, quality: number): Promise&amp;lt;Blob&amp;gt; =&amp;gt; {
  if (canvas instanceof OffscreenCanvas) {
    return canvas.convertToBlob({ type: mimeType, quality });
  }
  
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&amp;gt; {
    canvas.toBlob(
      (blob) =&amp;gt; blob ? resolve(blob) : reject(new Error(&amp;quot;Failed to create blob&amp;quot;)),
      mimeType,
      quality
    );
  });
};
```

### `src/features/image-processing/index.ts`

```ts
import { analyzeImage } from &amp;#039;./core/analyzer&amp;#039;;
import { compress } from &amp;#039;./core/compressor&amp;#039;;
import { loadImage, createCanvas } from &amp;#039;./core/manipulator&amp;#039;;
import { ProcessingOptions, ProcessedImage } from &amp;#039;./types&amp;#039;;

export * from &amp;#039;./types&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Process an image (Analyze -&amp;gt; Crop/Resize -&amp;gt; Compress)
 * Runs on the Main Thread.
 */
export const processImage = async (
  file: File | Blob,
  options: ProcessingOptions = {}
): Promise&amp;lt;ProcessedImage&amp;gt; =&amp;gt; {
  // 1. Load Image
  const img = await loadImage(file);

  // 2. Analyze
  const analysis = await analyzeImage(img);

  // 3. Calculate Dimensions
  let targetWidth = img.width;
  let targetHeight = img.height;

  if (options.cropArea) {
    // If manual crop, target dimensions are the crop dimensions unless specified otherwise
    targetWidth = options.maxWidth || options.cropArea.width;
    targetHeight = options.maxHeight || options.cropArea.height;
  } else {
    // Auto resize logic
    if (options.maxWidth &amp;amp;&amp;amp; options.maxHeight) {
      targetWidth = options.maxWidth;
      targetHeight = options.maxHeight;
    } else if (options.maxWidth) {
      const ratio = options.maxWidth / img.width;
      targetWidth = options.maxWidth;
      targetHeight = Math.round(img.height * ratio);
    } else if (options.maxHeight) {
      const ratio = options.maxHeight / img.height;
      targetHeight = options.maxHeight;
      targetWidth = Math.round(img.width * ratio);
    }
  }

  // 4. Create Canvas (Crop &amp;amp; Resize)
  const canvas = createCanvas(
    img,
    targetWidth,
    targetHeight,
    options.cropArea,
    analysis.hasTransparency,
    analysis.imageType
  );

  // 5. Compress
  // Default to WebP unless specified otherwise or transparency dictates PNG
  const format = options.outputFormat || analysis.suggestedFormat;
  
  const blob = await compress(
    canvas,
    format,
    0, // No strict target size for now, rely on quality
    analysis,
    options.quality || analysis.recommendedQuality
  );

  // 6. Return Result
  return {
    blob,
    fileName: (file as File).name || &amp;#039;image&amp;#039;,
    mimeType: format,
    size: blob.size,
    width: targetWidth,
    height: targetHeight,
    metadata: {
      quality: options.quality || analysis.recommendedQuality,
      originalSize: file.size,
      compressionRatio: parseFloat((file.size / blob.size).toFixed(2))
    }
  };
};

/**
 * Create a Worker instance for background processing.
 * Usage:
 * const worker = new Worker(new URL(&amp;#039;./worker/image.worker.ts&amp;#039;, import.meta.url));
 * processInWorker(worker, file, options).then(...);
 */
export const processInWorker = (
  worker: Worker,
  file: File | Blob,
  options: ProcessingOptions = {}
): Promise&amp;lt;ProcessedImage&amp;gt; =&amp;gt; {
  return new Promise((resolve, reject) =&amp;gt; {
    const id = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9);
    
    const handler = (e: MessageEvent) =&amp;gt; {
      if (e.data.id === id) {
        worker.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;message&amp;#039;, handler);
        if (e.data.success) {
          resolve(e.data.result);
        } else {
          reject(new Error(e.data.error));
        }
      }
    };

    worker.addEventListener(&amp;#039;message&amp;#039;, handler);
    worker.postMessage({ id, file, options });
  });
};
```

```ts
export interface ImageCropArea {
  x: number;
  y: number;
  width: number;
  height: number;
}

export interface ProcessingOptions {
  quality?: number; // 0 to 1
  maxWidth?: number;
  maxHeight?: number;
  cropArea?: ImageCropArea; // Manual crop
  aspectRatio?: number; // For auto smart crop if cropArea is missing
  outputFormat?: string; // mime type
  preserveExif?: boolean; // Future proofing
}

export interface ProcessedImage {
  blob: Blob;
  fileName: string;
  mimeType: string;
  size: number;
  width: number;
  height: number;
  metadata?: {
    quality: number;
    originalSize: number;
    compressionRatio: number;
  };
}

export interface AnalysisResult {
  recommendedQuality: number;
  imageType: &amp;#039;photo&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;graphic&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;simple&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;complex&amp;#039;;
  hasTransparency: boolean;
  suggestedFormat: string;
}
```

### `src/features/image-processing/worker/image.worker.ts`

```ts
import { analyzeImage } from &amp;#039;../core/analyzer&amp;#039;;
import { compress } from &amp;#039;../core/compressor&amp;#039;;
import { loadImage, createCanvas } from &amp;#039;../core/manipulator&amp;#039;;
import { ProcessingOptions, ProcessedImage } from &amp;#039;../types&amp;#039;;

// Worker message types
type WorkerMessage = {
  id: string;
  file: File | Blob;
  options: ProcessingOptions;
};

self.onmessage = async (e: MessageEvent&amp;lt;WorkerMessage&amp;gt;) =&amp;gt; {
  const { id, file, options } = e.data;

  try {
    // 1. Load Image
    const img = await loadImage(file);

    // 2. Analyze
    const analysis = await analyzeImage(img);

    // 3. Determine dimensions
    const targetWidth = options.maxWidth || img.width;
    const targetHeight = options.maxHeight || img.height;
    // Note: If aspect ratio is enforced, it should be calculated here or passed in options
    // For now, we assume options.maxWidth/Height are the final desired dimensions or we use original

    // 4. Create Canvas (Crop &amp;amp; Resize)
    const canvas = createCanvas(
      img,
      targetWidth,
      targetHeight,
      options.cropArea,
      analysis.hasTransparency,
      analysis.imageType
    );

    // 5. Compress
    const format = options.outputFormat || analysis.suggestedFormat;
    // Target size is optional, if not provided, compressor uses quality only
    const targetSize = 0; // We could add this to options if needed
    
    const blob = await compress(
      canvas,
      format,
      targetSize,
      analysis,
      options.quality || analysis.recommendedQuality
    );

    // 6. Response
    const result: ProcessedImage = {
      blob,
      fileName: (file as File).name || &amp;#039;processed_image&amp;#039;,
      mimeType: format,
      size: blob.size,
      width: targetWidth,
      height: targetHeight,
      metadata: {
        quality: options.quality || analysis.recommendedQuality,
        originalSize: file.size,
        compressionRatio: file.size / blob.size
      }
    };

    self.postMessage({ id, success: true, result });

  } catch (error: any) {
    self.postMessage({ id, success: false, error: error.message });
  }
};
```

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useEffect } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

/**
 * PWA Init - Conditional loading, no overhead náº¿u khÃ´ng dÃ¹ng
 * Chá»‰ cháº¡y khi browser support SW, khÃ´ng tá»‘n transfer/compute náº¿u khÃ´ng cáº§n
 */
export default function PwaInit() {
  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    // Guard: skip náº¿u khÃ´ng há»— trá»£ SW
    if (!(&amp;#039;serviceWorker&amp;#039; in navigator)) return;

    // Register SW during idle - khÃ´ng block main thread
    const registerSW = () =&amp;gt; {
      navigator.serviceWorker
        .register(&amp;#039;/sw.js&amp;#039;, {
          scope: &amp;#039;/&amp;#039;,
          updateViaCache: &amp;#039;none&amp;#039;,
        })
        .then((reg) =&amp;gt; {
          // Auto-update check (1h interval)
          const checkUpdate = () =&amp;gt; reg.update();
          const interval = setInterval(checkUpdate, 3600000);
          
          // Cleanup on unmount
          return () =&amp;gt; clearInterval(interval);
        })
        .catch((err) =&amp;gt; console.error(&amp;#039;[SW] Failed:&amp;#039;, err));
    };

    // Use idle callback Ä‘á»ƒ khÃ´ng áº£nh hÆ°á»Ÿng startup
    if (&amp;#039;requestIdleCallback&amp;#039; in window) {
      requestIdleCallback(registerSW, { timeout: 2000 });
    } else {
      setTimeout(registerSW, 1);
    }

    // PWA standalone detection (chá»‰ set attribute khi cáº§n)
    const isPWA =
      window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(display-mode: standalone)&amp;#039;).matches ||
      (navigator as any).standalone;

    if (isPWA) {
      document.documentElement.dataset.pwa = &amp;#039;true&amp;#039;;
      document.documentElement.setAttribute(&amp;#039;translate&amp;#039;, &amp;#039;no&amp;#039;);
    }
  }, []);

  return null;
}
```

### `src/features/pwa/hooks/use-pwa-install.ts`

```ts
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useState, useEffect } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

interface BeforeInstallPromptEvent extends Event {
  prompt: () =&amp;gt; Promise&amp;lt;void&amp;gt;;
  userChoice: Promise&amp;lt;{ outcome: &amp;#039;accepted&amp;#039; | &amp;#039;dismissed&amp;#039;; platform: string }&amp;gt;;
}

export function usePWAInstall() {
  const [deferredPrompt, setDeferredPrompt] = useState&amp;lt;BeforeInstallPromptEvent | null&amp;gt;(null);
  const [isInstallable, setIsInstallable] = useState(false);
  const [isInstalled, setIsInstalled] = useState(false);

  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    // Check if already installed (standalone mode)
    if (typeof window !== &amp;#039;undefined&amp;#039;) {
      const isStandalone = window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(display-mode: standalone)&amp;#039;).matches;
      setIsInstalled(isStandalone);
    }

    const handleBeforeInstallPrompt = (e: Event) =&amp;gt; {
      // Prevent the mini-infobar from appearing on mobile
      e.preventDefault();
      // Stash the event so it can be triggered later.
      setDeferredPrompt(e as BeforeInstallPromptEvent);
      // Update UI notify the user they can install the PWA
      setIsInstallable(true);
    };

    const handleAppInstalled = () =&amp;gt; {
      // Log install to analytics if needed
      setIsInstallable(false);
      setDeferredPrompt(null);
      setIsInstalled(true);
    };

    window.addEventListener(&amp;#039;beforeinstallprompt&amp;#039;, handleBeforeInstallPrompt);
    window.addEventListener(&amp;#039;appinstalled&amp;#039;, handleAppInstalled);

    return () =&amp;gt; {
      window.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;beforeinstallprompt&amp;#039;, handleBeforeInstallPrompt);
      window.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;appinstalled&amp;#039;, handleAppInstalled);
    };
  }, []);

  const install = async () =&amp;gt; {
    if (!deferredPrompt) return;

    // Show the install prompt
    await deferredPrompt.prompt();

    // Wait for the user to respond to the prompt
    const choiceResult = await deferredPrompt.userChoice;
    
    if (choiceResult.outcome === &amp;#039;accepted&amp;#039;) {
      setIsInstallable(false);
    }
    
    setDeferredPrompt(null);
  };

  return { isInstallable, isInstalled, install };
}
```

```ts
import { useQuery } from &amp;#039;@tanstack/react-query&amp;#039;;
import { getSystemConfig } from &amp;#039;./actions&amp;#039;;

export const systemQueries = {
  all: [&amp;#039;system&amp;#039;] as const,
  config: () =&amp;gt; [...systemQueries.all, &amp;#039;config&amp;#039;] as const,
};

export function useSystemConfig() {
  return useQuery({
    queryKey: systemQueries.config(),
    queryFn: () =&amp;gt; getSystemConfig(),
    // Config is static for the session usually, so cache it aggressively
    staleTime: Infinity,
    gcTime: Infinity,
    refetchOnWindowFocus: false,
    refetchOnMount: false,
    // Use client-side env as initial data to prevent layout shift/flicker
    // This acts as the &amp;quot;browser cache&amp;quot; layer before the &amp;quot;server request&amp;quot;
    initialData: {
      logoUrl: process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_LOGO_URL || &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
    },
  });
}
```

### `src/i18n/request.ts`

```ts
import {getRequestConfig} from &amp;#039;next-intl/server&amp;#039;;
import {routing} from &amp;#039;./routing&amp;#039;;
import { cache } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

// Cache individual message file loads to prevent redundant imports
const loadMessages = cache(async (locale: string) =&amp;gt; {
  // Load all files
  const common = (await import(`../messages/${locale}/common.json`)).default;
  const auth = (await import(`../messages/${locale}/auth.json`)).default;
  const account = (await import(`../messages/${locale}/account.json`)).default;
  const login = (await import(`../messages/${locale}/login.json`)).default;
  const landing = (await import(`../messages/${locale}/landing.json`)).default;
  
  // Deep merge to avoid key conflicts
  // auth.json has: { account: { settings }, userMenu }
  // account.json has: { account: { title, tabs, general, profile, security, ... } }
  // landing.json has: { hero, features, cta, footer }
  // We need to merge account keys manually
  return {
    common,
    landing,  // Landing page translations (separated)
    userMenu: auth.userMenu,
    account: {
      ...auth.account,      // { settings }
      ...account.account,   // { title, tabs, general, ... }
    },
    login: login.login,
  };
});
 
export default getRequestConfig(async ({requestLocale}) =&amp;gt; {
  // This typically corresponds to the `[locale]` segment
  let locale = await requestLocale;
 
  // Ensure that a valid locale is used
  if (!locale || !routing.locales.includes(locale as any)) {
    locale = routing.defaultLocale;
  }
 
  return {
    locale,
    messages: await loadMessages(locale)
  };
});

```

```ts
import {defineRouting} from &amp;#039;next-intl/routing&amp;#039;;
import {createNavigation} from &amp;#039;next-intl/navigation&amp;#039;;

export const routing = defineRouting({
  // A list of all locales that are supported
  locales: [&amp;#039;en&amp;#039;, &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;],

  // Used when no locale matches
  defaultLocale: &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;,
  
  // Always use locale prefix in URL
  localePrefix: &amp;#039;always&amp;#039;,
  
  // Enable automatic locale detection from Accept-Language header
  localeDetection: true
});

// Lightweight wrappers around Next.js&amp;#039; navigation APIs
// that will consider the routing configuration
export const {Link, redirect, usePathname, useRouter, getPathname} =
  createNavigation(routing);
```

```ts
/**
```

```ts
 * 
 * SINGLETON PATTERN: Pool instance Ä‘Æ°á»£c cache Ä‘á»ƒ trÃ¡nh táº¡o nhiá»u connections
 * 
 * ĞšĞĞ“Ğ”Ğ DÃ™NG:
 * âœ… Server Actions (handleGoogleCallback, createUser, etc.)
 * âœ… Route Handlers (/api/*)
 * âœ… Server Components cáº§n transactions
 * âœ… Batch operations (multiple queries)
 * âœ… Complex CRUD operations
 * 
 * Æ¯U ÄIá»‚M:
 * - Há»— trá»£ transactions (CRITICAL cho OAuth flow)

 * 
 * NHÆ¯á»¢C ÄIá»‚M:
 * - First connection cháº­m hÆ¡n (~37ms)
 * - KhÃ´ng dÃ¹ng Ä‘Æ°á»£c trong Middleware (Edge Runtime)
```

### `src/lib/r2-config.ts`

```ts
/**
 * Cloudflare R2 Storage Configuration
 * Centralized path management for all storage assets
 */

/**
 * R2 Bucket Path Structure:
 * - static/         â†’ Admin-managed assets (logos, default avatars, etc.)
 * - user-uploads/   â†’ User-generated content
 *   - avatars/      â†’ User profile pictures
 *   - documents/    â†’ User documents (future)
 *   - media/        â†’ User media files (future)
 */
export const R2_PATHS = {
  // Static assets managed by admin
  STATIC: {
    ROOT: &amp;#039;static&amp;#039;,
    DEFAULT_AVATAR: &amp;#039;static/default-avatar.webp&amp;#039;,
    LOGO: &amp;#039;static/logo.webp&amp;#039;,
    LOGO_DARK: &amp;#039;static/logo-dark.webp&amp;#039;,
  },
  
  // User-generated content
  USER: {
    ROOT: &amp;#039;&amp;#039;,
    AVATARS: &amp;#039;avatars&amp;#039;,
    DOCUMENTS: &amp;#039;documents&amp;#039;,
    MEDIA: &amp;#039;media&amp;#039;,
  },
} as const;

/**
 * File size limits (in bytes)
 */
export const FILE_LIMITS = {
  AVATAR: {
    MAX_SIZE: 50 * 1024, // 50KB (aggressive for now)
    ALLOWED_TYPES: [&amp;#039;image/webp&amp;#039;],
    ALLOWED_MIME: &amp;#039;image/webp&amp;#039;,
  },
  DOCUMENT: {
    MAX_SIZE: 5 * 1024 * 1024, // 5MB (future)
    ALLOWED_TYPES: [&amp;#039;application/pdf&amp;#039;],
  },
} as const;

/**
 * Cache control headers
 */
export const CACHE_HEADERS = {
  STATIC: &amp;#039;public, max-age=31536000, immutable&amp;#039;, // 1 year
  USER_AVATAR: &amp;#039;public, max-age=31536000, immutable&amp;#039;, // Use nanoid for cache busting
  DYNAMIC: &amp;#039;public, max-age=3600&amp;#039;, // 1 hour
} as const;

/**
 * Build user avatar path
 */
export function getUserAvatarPath(userPublicId: string, filename: string): string {
  return `${R2_PATHS.USER.AVATARS}/${userPublicId}/${filename}`;
}

/**
 * Build static asset path
 */
export function getStaticAssetPath(filename: string): string {
  return `${R2_PATHS.STATIC.ROOT}/${filename}`;
}

```

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import {
  QueryClient,
  QueryClientProvider,
} from &amp;#039;@tanstack/react-query&amp;#039;;
import { ReactQueryDevtools } from &amp;#039;@tanstack/react-query-devtools&amp;#039;;
import * as React from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;

function makeQueryClient() {
  return new QueryClient({
    defaultOptions: {
      queries: {
        // Optimized for i18n: aggressive caching to reduce Vercel compute costs
        // and prevent unnecessary refetches during language switches
        // Components can override these values if needed
        staleTime: 5 * 60 * 1000,        // 5 minutes - balance freshness vs performance
        gcTime: 10 * 60 * 1000,          // 10 minutes - keep in cache longer
        
        // CRITICAL i18n optimizations:
        refetchOnMount: false,            // Use cache when component remounts (route change)
        refetchOnWindowFocus: false,      // Prevent refetch when tab regains focus
        refetchOnReconnect: false,        // Prevent refetch on network reconnect
        
        retry: 1,                         // Reduce retry attempts from 3 to 1
      },
      mutations: {
        retry: 0,                         // Don&amp;#039;t retry mutations by default
      },
    },
  });
}

let browserQueryClient: QueryClient | undefined = undefined;

function getQueryClient() {
  if (typeof window === &amp;#039;undefined&amp;#039;) {
    // Server: always make a new query client
    return makeQueryClient();
  } else {
    // Browser: make a new query client if we don&amp;#039;t already have one
    // This is very important, so we don&amp;#039;t re-make a new client if React
    // suspends during the initial render. This may not be needed if we
    // have a suspense boundary BELOW the creation of the query client
    if (!browserQueryClient) browserQueryClient = makeQueryClient();
    return browserQueryClient;
  }
}

export function QueryProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  // NOTE: Avoid useState when initializing the query client if you don&amp;#039;t
  //       have a suspense boundary between this and the code that may
  //       suspend because React will throw away the client on the initial
  //       render if it suspends and there is no boundary
  const queryClient = getQueryClient();

  return (
    &amp;lt;QueryClientProvider client={queryClient}&amp;gt;
      {children}
      &amp;lt;ReactQueryDevtools initialIsOpen={false} /&amp;gt;
    &amp;lt;/QueryClientProvider&amp;gt;
  );
}
```

### `src/providers/theme-provider.tsx`

```tsx
&amp;#039;use client&amp;#039;;

import { useEffect, useLayoutEffect } from &amp;#039;react&amp;#039;;
import { usePathname } from &amp;#039;next/navigation&amp;#039;;

/**
 * ThemeProvider
 * 
 * Responsible for syncing the theme (dark/light) from localStorage to the DOM (html class).
 * Uses MutationObserver to prevent React or other scripts from removing the &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039; class
 * when it should be present (e.g. during next-intl language switches).
 * 
 * Also temporarily disables transitions during navigation to prevent FOUC (Flash of Unstyled Content).
 */
export function ThemeProvider({ children }: { children: React.ReactNode }) {
  const pathname = usePathname();
  // useLayoutEffect ensures the class is applied before painting
  const useIsomorphicLayoutEffect = typeof window !== &amp;#039;undefined&amp;#039; ? useLayoutEffect : useEffect;

  useIsomorphicLayoutEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    // 1. Initial sync
    syncTheme();

    // 2. Observer to protect the class
    // When React re-renders the root layout (e.g. lang change), it might wipe the class.
    // This observer puts it back immediately.
    const observer = new MutationObserver((mutations) =&amp;gt; {
      mutations.forEach((mutation) =&amp;gt; {
        if (
          mutation.type === &amp;#039;attributes&amp;#039; &amp;amp;&amp;amp; 
          mutation.attributeName === &amp;#039;class&amp;#039;
        ) {
          const isDark = document.documentElement.classList.contains(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
          const shouldBeDark = getExpectedTheme() === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;;
          
          if (shouldBeDark &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !isDark) {
            document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
          }
        }
      });
    });

    observer.observe(document.documentElement, {
      attributes: true,
      attributeFilter: [&amp;#039;class&amp;#039;],
    });

    return () =&amp;gt; observer.disconnect();
  }, [pathname]); // Re-setup on path change just in case, though observer is persistent

  // 3. Disable transitions during navigation (path change)
  useIsomorphicLayoutEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    // Add a class to body or html that disables transitions
    const style = document.createElement(&amp;#039;style&amp;#039;);
    style.innerHTML = `
      *, *::before, *::after {
        transition: none !important;
        animation: none !important;
      }
    `;
    style.id = &amp;#039;theme-transition-blocker&amp;#039;;
    document.head.appendChild(style);

    // Remove it after a short delay to allow the DOM to settle
    const timeout = setTimeout(() =&amp;gt; {
      const element = document.getElementById(&amp;#039;theme-transition-blocker&amp;#039;);
      if (element) {
        element.remove();
      }
    }, 100); // 100ms is usually enough for the browser to paint the new state without animating

    return () =&amp;gt; {
      clearTimeout(timeout);
      const element = document.getElementById(&amp;#039;theme-transition-blocker&amp;#039;);
      if (element) {
        element.remove();
      }
    };
  }, [pathname]);

  // 4. Listen for storage changes (sync across tabs)
  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    const handleStorage = (e: StorageEvent) =&amp;gt; {
      if (e.key === &amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;) {
        syncTheme();
      }
    };
    window.addEventListener(&amp;#039;storage&amp;#039;, handleStorage);
    return () =&amp;gt; window.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;storage&amp;#039;, handleStorage);
  }, []);

  // 5. Listen for system preference changes
  useEffect(() =&amp;gt; {
    const mediaQuery = window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&amp;#039;);
    const handleChange = () =&amp;gt; syncTheme();
    mediaQuery.addEventListener(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;, handleChange);
    return () =&amp;gt; mediaQuery.removeEventListener(&amp;#039;change&amp;#039;, handleChange);
  }, []);

  return &amp;lt;&amp;gt;{children}&amp;lt;/&amp;gt;;
}

function getExpectedTheme() {
  try {
    const stored = localStorage.getItem(&amp;#039;theme&amp;#039;);
    if (stored === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;) return &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;;
    if (stored === &amp;#039;light&amp;#039;) return &amp;#039;light&amp;#039;;
    
    // System fallback
    if (window.matchMedia(&amp;#039;(prefers-color-scheme: dark)&amp;#039;).matches) {
      return &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;;
    }
  } catch (e) {
    // Ignore
  }
  return &amp;#039;light&amp;#039;;
}

function syncTheme() {
  const theme = getExpectedTheme();
  if (theme === &amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;) {
    if (!document.documentElement.classList.contains(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;)) {
      document.documentElement.classList.add(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
    }
  } else {
    if (document.documentElement.classList.contains(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;)) {
      document.documentElement.classList.remove(&amp;#039;dark&amp;#039;);
    }
  }
}
```

### `src/proxy.ts`

```ts
import { NextResponse, NextRequest } from &amp;#039;next/server&amp;#039;;
import createMiddleware from &amp;#039;next-intl/middleware&amp;#039;;
import { routing } from &amp;#039;./i18n/routing&amp;#039;;
import { sql } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-http&amp;#039;; // HTTP driver - Edge Runtime compatible

// Create next-intl middleware
const intlMiddleware = createMiddleware(routing);
 
// Public routes that don&amp;#039;t require authentication
const PUBLIC_ROUTES = [
  &amp;#039;/api/auth/callback/google&amp;#039;, 
  &amp;#039;/api/auth/callback/facebook&amp;#039;,
  &amp;#039;/learn/login&amp;#039;, // This will be localized, e.g. /vi/learn/login
];

/**
 * Middleware for session validation and auth redirects
 * Uses Neon HTTP (not Pool) for Edge Runtime compatibility
 * 
 * Route Structure:
 * - Root (/) is public landing page
 * - /learn/* requires authentication (except /learn/login)
 * - Authenticated users redirected away from /learn/login
 */
export async function proxy(request: NextRequest) {
  const { pathname } = request.nextUrl;

  // 1. Handle API and static files - skip i18n
  if (pathname.startsWith(&amp;#039;/api&amp;#039;) || pathname.startsWith(&amp;#039;/_next&amp;#039;) || pathname.includes(&amp;#039;.&amp;#039;)) {
    return NextResponse.next();
  }

  // 2. Run next-intl middleware first to handle locale redirects/rewrites
  // This ensures we have the correct locale in the URL
  const response = intlMiddleware(request);

  // 3. Auth Logic
  // We need to check if the current path (after potential i18n rewrite/redirect) is protected.
  // However, intlMiddleware might return a redirect (e.g. / -&amp;gt; /vi). If so, we should let it happen.
  if (response.headers.get(&amp;#039;location&amp;#039;)) {
    return response;
  }

  // Check session cookie
  const sessionToken = request.cookies.get(&amp;#039;session&amp;#039;)?.value;

  // Extract locale from pathname if present (e.g. /vi/learn...)
  // or rely on the fact that intlMiddleware has already handled the locale part.
  // We can check if the path contains /learn
  
  // Note: pathname might be /vi/learn/login or /en/learn/login
  const isLoginRoute = pathname.includes(&amp;#039;/learn/login&amp;#039;);
  const isLearnRoute = pathname.includes(&amp;#039;/learn&amp;#039;);

  // Special handling for login route
  if (isLoginRoute) {
    if (!sessionToken) {
      return response; // Allow access
    }
    
    // Validate session
    try {
      const sessions = await sql`
        SELECT id, expires_at 
        FROM sessions 
        WHERE session_token = ${sessionToken}
        LIMIT 1
      `;
      
      if (sessions.length &amp;gt; 0) {
        const expiresAt = new Date(sessions[0].expires_at);
        if (expiresAt &amp;gt; new Date()) {
          // Session valid - redirect to /learn (preserving locale)
          // We need to construct the URL with the current locale
          // But simpler: just redirect to /learn, next-intl middleware will handle the locale on next request?
          // No, we should try to preserve locale.
          // Let&amp;#039;s assume the user is at /vi/learn/login, we want /vi/learn.
          // We can use the request.nextUrl.locale if available, but it&amp;#039;s not in middleware.
          // We can parse the locale from pathname.
          const locale = routing.locales.find(l =&amp;gt; pathname.startsWith(`/${l}`)) || routing.defaultLocale;
          return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn`, request.url));
        }
      }
      return response;
    } catch (error) {
      console.error(&amp;#039;Session check error for login:&amp;#039;, error);
      return response;
    }
  }
  
  // Protected routes (/learn/*)
  if (isLearnRoute &amp;amp;&amp;amp; !isLoginRoute) {
    if (!sessionToken) {
      const locale = routing.locales.find(l =&amp;gt; pathname.startsWith(`/${l}`)) || routing.defaultLocale;
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login`, request.url));
    }
    
    try {
      const sessions = await sql`
        SELECT id, expires_at 
        FROM sessions 
        WHERE session_token = ${sessionToken}
        LIMIT 1
      `;
      
      if (sessions.length === 0) {
        const redirectResp = NextResponse.redirect(new URL(request.url)); // Reload to trigger login redirect above? Or manual redirect
        // Better: redirect to login
        const locale = routing.locales.find(l =&amp;gt; pathname.startsWith(`/${l}`)) || routing.defaultLocale;
        const resp = NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login`, request.url));
        resp.cookies.delete(&amp;#039;session&amp;#039;);
        return resp;
      }
      
      const session = sessions[0];
      const expiresAt = new Date(session.expires_at);
      
      if (expiresAt &amp;lt; new Date()) {
        const locale = routing.locales.find(l =&amp;gt; pathname.startsWith(`/${l}`)) || routing.defaultLocale;
        const resp = NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login`, request.url));
        resp.cookies.delete(&amp;#039;session&amp;#039;);
        return resp;
      }
      
      return response;
    } catch (error) {
      console.error(&amp;#039;Session validation error:&amp;#039;, error);
      const locale = routing.locales.find(l =&amp;gt; pathname.startsWith(`/${l}`)) || routing.defaultLocale;
      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL(`/${locale}/learn/login`, request.url));
    }
  }

  return response;
}
 
export const config = {
  // Match all pathnames except for
  // - â€¦ if they start with `/api`, `/_next` or `/_vercel`
  // - â€¦ the ones containing a dot (e.g. `favicon.ico`)
  matcher: [
    &amp;#039;/((?!api|_next|_vercel|.*\\..*).*)&amp;#039;,
    // However, match all pathnames within /users, optionally with a locale prefix
    // &amp;#039;/([\\w-]+)?/users/(.+)&amp;#039;
  ]
};
```

```ts
import { cookies } from &amp;#039;next/headers&amp;#039;;

const COOKIE_NAME = process.env.SESSION_COOKIE_NAME || &amp;#039;session&amp;#039;;
const MAX_AGE = Number(process.env.SESSION_MAX_AGE) || 2592000; // 30 days

/**
 * Set session cookie with secure flags
 * Next.js 16: cookies() is async
 */
export async function setSessionCookie(token: string) {
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  cookieStore.set(COOKIE_NAME, token, {
    httpOnly: true,
    secure: process.env.NODE_ENV === &amp;#039;production&amp;#039;,
    sameSite: &amp;#039;lax&amp;#039;,
    maxAge: MAX_AGE,
    path: &amp;#039;/&amp;#039;,
  });
}

/**
 * Get session cookie value
 */
export async function getSessionCookie(): Promise&amp;lt;string | undefined&amp;gt; {
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  return cookieStore.get(COOKIE_NAME)?.value;
}

/**
 * Delete session cookie
 */
export async function deleteSessionCookie() {
  const cookieStore = await cookies();
  cookieStore.delete(COOKIE_NAME);
}
```

```ts
import { randomBytes } from &amp;#039;crypto&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Generate a cryptographically secure session token
 * @returns URL-safe base64 encoded token (43 characters)
 */
export function generateSessionToken(): string {
  return randomBytes(32).toString(&amp;#039;base64url&amp;#039;);
}

/**
 * Generate a state parameter for OAuth CSRF protection
 * @returns URL-safe base64 encoded state (22 characters)
 */
export function generateState(): string {
  return randomBytes(16).toString(&amp;#039;base64url&amp;#039;);
}
```

```ts
/**
 * Get real client IP address from headers
 * Handles proxies (Vercel, Cloudflare, Nginx) correctly
 */
export function getClientIp(headers: Headers): string | null {
  let ip: string | null = null;
  
  // x-forwarded-for can contain multiple IPs: &amp;quot;client, proxy1, proxy2&amp;quot;
  // The first one is the original client IP
  const forwardedFor = headers.get(&amp;#039;x-forwarded-for&amp;#039;);
  if (forwardedFor) {
    const ips = forwardedFor.split(&amp;#039;,&amp;#039;).map(ip =&amp;gt; ip.trim());
    ip = ips[0] || null;
  }
  
  // Fallback to other headers
  if (!ip) {
    ip = headers.get(&amp;#039;x-real-ip&amp;#039;);
  }
  
  // Cloudflare specific
  if (!ip) {
    ip = headers.get(&amp;#039;cf-connecting-ip&amp;#039;);
  }
  
  if (!ip) return null;
  
  // Normalize localhost IPs
  // ::1 (IPv6 localhost) -&amp;gt; 127.0.0.1
  // ::ffff:127.0.0.1 (IPv4-mapped IPv6) -&amp;gt; 127.0.0.1
  if (ip === &amp;#039;::1&amp;#039; || ip === &amp;#039;::ffff:127.0.0.1&amp;#039;) {
    return &amp;#039;127.0.0.1&amp;#039;;
  }
  
  // Remove IPv6 prefix if exists
  if (ip.startsWith(&amp;#039;::ffff:&amp;#039;)) {
    return ip.substring(7);
  }
  
  return ip;
}
```

```ts
import { customAlphabet } from &amp;#039;nanoid&amp;#039;;
import { db } from &amp;#039;@/lib/db-http&amp;#039;; // HTTP driver for faster single-shot queries
import { users } from &amp;#039;@/db/drizzle&amp;#039;;
import { eq } from &amp;#039;drizzle-orm&amp;#039;;

/**
 * Generate a unique username with collision retry
 * Format: user_xxxxx (max 15 chars to fit varchar(20))
 * Characters: lowercase a-z, 0-9 to match validation regex
 */
export async function generateUniqueUsername(): Promise&amp;lt;string&amp;gt; {
  const maxRetries = 5;
  const generateId = customAlphabet(&amp;#039;0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz&amp;#039;, 10);
  
  for (let i = 0; i &amp;lt; maxRetries; i++) {
    // Generate username: user_ + 10 random chars = 15 chars total
    const username = `user_${generateId()}`;
    
    // Check for collision using HTTP driver (faster for single reads)
    const existing = await db.query.users.findFirst({
      where: eq(users.username, username),
      columns: { id: true },
    });
    
    if (!existing) {
      return username;
    }
  }
  
  throw new Error(&amp;#039;Failed to generate unique username after 5 retries&amp;#039;);
}
```

```ts
import bcrypt from &amp;#039;bcrypt&amp;#039;;

const SALT_ROUNDS = 12;

/**
 * Hash password using bcrypt
 */
export async function hashPassword(password: string): Promise&amp;lt;string&amp;gt; {
  return bcrypt.hash(password, SALT_ROUNDS);
}

/**
 * Verify password against hash
 */
export async function verifyPassword(password: string, hash: string): Promise&amp;lt;boolean&amp;gt; {
  return bcrypt.compare(password, hash);
}
```

```ts
/**
 * Format a date as relative time (e.g., &amp;quot;2 days ago&amp;quot;, &amp;quot;3 hours ago&amp;quot;)
 * Optimized for Vietnamese and English locales
 */
export function formatRelativeTime(date: Date, locale: string = &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;): string {
  const now = new Date();
  const diffInMs = now.getTime() - date.getTime();
  const diffInSeconds = Math.floor(diffInMs / 1000);
  const diffInMinutes = Math.floor(diffInSeconds / 60);
  const diffInHours = Math.floor(diffInMinutes / 60);
  const diffInDays = Math.floor(diffInHours / 24);
  const diffInMonths = Math.floor(diffInDays / 30);
  const diffInYears = Math.floor(diffInDays / 365);

  const isVietnamese = locale === &amp;#039;vi&amp;#039;;

  // Just now (&amp;lt; 1 minute)
  if (diffInMinutes &amp;lt; 1) {
    return isVietnamese ? &amp;#039;Vá»«a xong&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;Just now&amp;#039;;
  }

  // Minutes ago (&amp;lt; 1 hour)
  if (diffInHours &amp;lt; 1) {
    return isVietnamese
      ? `${diffInMinutes} phÃºt trÆ°á»›c`
      : `${diffInMinutes} minute${diffInMinutes &amp;gt; 1 ? &amp;#039;s&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;} ago`;
  }

  // Hours ago (&amp;lt; 1 day)
  if (diffInDays &amp;lt; 1) {
    return isVietnamese
      ? `${diffInHours} giá» trÆ°á»›c`
      : `${diffInHours} hour${diffInHours &amp;gt; 1 ? &amp;#039;s&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;} ago`;
  }

  // Days ago (&amp;lt; 1 month)
  if (diffInMonths &amp;lt; 1) {
    return isVietnamese
      ? `${diffInDays} ngÃ y trÆ°á»›c`
      : `${diffInDays} day${diffInDays &amp;gt; 1 ? &amp;#039;s&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;} ago`;
  }

  // Months ago (&amp;lt; 1 year)
  if (diffInYears &amp;lt; 1) {
    return isVietnamese
      ? `${diffInMonths} thÃ¡ng trÆ°á»›c`
      : `${diffInMonths} month${diffInMonths &amp;gt; 1 ? &amp;#039;s&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;} ago`;
  }

  // Years ago
  return isVietnamese
    ? `${diffInYears} nÄƒm trÆ°á»›c`
    : `${diffInYears} year${diffInYears &amp;gt; 1 ? &amp;#039;s&amp;#039; : &amp;#039;&amp;#039;} ago`;
}
```

### `src/utils/user-agent.ts`

```ts
export interface ParsedUserAgent {
  browser: string;
  os: string;
  device: string;
}

export function parseUserAgent(ua: string | null): ParsedUserAgent {
  if (!ua) {
    return {
      browser: &amp;#039;Unknown Browser&amp;#039;,
      os: &amp;#039;Unknown OS&amp;#039;,
      device: &amp;#039;Unknown Device&amp;#039;,
    };
  }

  let browser = &amp;#039;Unknown Browser&amp;#039;;
  let os = &amp;#039;Unknown OS&amp;#039;;
  let device = &amp;#039;Desktop&amp;#039;;

  // Browser Detection
  if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Firefox&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Firefox&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;SamsungBrowser&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Samsung Internet&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Opera&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;OPR&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Opera&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Trident&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Internet Explorer&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Edge&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;Edg&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Microsoft Edge&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Chrome&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Chrome&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Safari&amp;#039;)) {
    browser = &amp;#039;Safari&amp;#039;;
  }

  // OS Detection
  if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Windows&amp;#039;)) {
    os = &amp;#039;Windows&amp;#039;;
    if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Windows NT 10.0&amp;#039;)) os = &amp;#039;Windows 10/11&amp;#039;;
    if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Windows NT 6.3&amp;#039;)) os = &amp;#039;Windows 8.1&amp;#039;;
    if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Windows NT 6.2&amp;#039;)) os = &amp;#039;Windows 8&amp;#039;;
    if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Windows NT 6.1&amp;#039;)) os = &amp;#039;Windows 7&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Android&amp;#039;)) {
    os = &amp;#039;Android&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;iPhone&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;iPad&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;iPod&amp;#039;)) {
    os = &amp;#039;iOS&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Mac OS X&amp;#039;)) {
    os = &amp;#039;macOS&amp;#039;;
  } else if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Linux&amp;#039;)) {
    os = &amp;#039;Linux&amp;#039;;
  }

  // Device Detection
  if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;Mobile&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;Android&amp;#039;) || ua.includes(&amp;#039;iPhone&amp;#039;)) {
    device = &amp;#039;Mobile&amp;#039;;
    if (ua.includes(&amp;#039;iPad&amp;#039;)) device = &amp;#039;Tablet&amp;#039;;
  }

  return { browser, os, device };
}
```

const EXCLUDED_DIRS = [&#039;node_modules&#039;, &#039;.next&#039;, &#039;vendor&#039;, &#039;.git&#039;, &#039;public&#039;, &#039;dist&#039;, &#039;build&#039;, &#039;storage&#039;, &#039;.idea&#039;, &#039;.vscode&#039;];
const EXCLUDED_FILES = [&#039;.env&#039;, &#039;.env.local&#039;, &#039;package-lock.json&#039;, &#039;composer.lock&#039;, &#039;.DS_Store&#039;, &#039;yarn.lock&#039;];

// Xá»­ lÃ½ láº¥y cÃ¢y thÆ° má»¥c (Structure Only)
function handle_structure_request()
{
  header(&#039;Content-Type: application/json&#039;);
  try {
    $projectPath = rtrim(urldecode($_GET[&#039;path&#039;]), &#039;\\/&#039;);
    if (!is_dir($projectPath)) throw new Exception(&quot;ÄÆ°á»ng dáº«n khÃ´ng há»£p lá»‡.&quot;);

    $filesToProcess = get_files_to_process($projectPath);

      &#039;status&#039; =&gt; &#039;success&#039;,
      &#039;data&#039; =&gt; $treeString,
      &#039;count&#039; =&gt; count($filesToProcess)
    ]);
  } catch (Throwable $e) {
    echo json_encode([
      &#039;status&#039; =&gt; &#039;error&#039;,
      &#039;message&#039; =&gt; $e-&gt;getMessage()
    ]);
  }

}

// Xá»­ lÃ½ táº¡o Full Docs (SSE)
function handle_generation_request()
{
  global $resultsDir;
  header(&#039;Content-Type: text/event-stream&#039;);
  header(&#039;Cache-Control: no-cache&#039;);
  header(&#039;Connection: keep-alive&#039;);

  try {
    write_log(&quot;================== NEW FULL REQUEST ==================&quot;);
    $projectPath = rtrim(urldecode($_GET[&#039;path&#039;]), &#039;\\/&#039;);

    if (!is_dir($projectPath)) throw new Exception(&quot;ÄÆ°á»ng dáº«n khÃ´ng há»£p lá»‡.&quot;);
    if (!is_dir($resultsDir)) mkdir($resultsDir, 0777, true);

    send_sse_message(&#039;log&#039;, &#039;BÆ°á»›c 1: QuÃ©t file...&#039;);
    $filesToProcess = get_files_to_process($projectPath);
    $totalFiles = count($filesToProcess);

    if ($totalFiles === 0) throw new Exception(&quot;KhÃ´ng tÃ¬m tháº¥y file há»£p lá»‡.&quot;);

    send_sse_message(&#039;log&#039;, &quot;TÃ¬m tháº¥y {$totalFiles} file. Äang xá»­ lÃ½...&quot;);
    $markdownContent = generate_markdown($projectPath, $filesToProcess);

    $safeFilename = preg_replace(&#039;/[^A-Za-z0-9_\-]/&#039;, &#039;_&#039;, basename($projectPath));
    $outputFilename = &#039;docs_&#039; . $safeFilename . &#039;_&#039; . date(&#039;YmdHis&#039;) . &#039;.md&#039;;
    $outputFilePath = $resultsDir . &#039;/&#039; . $outputFilename;

    file_put_contents($outputFilePath, $markdownContent);
    send_sse_message(&#039;complete&#039;, basename($outputFilePath), [&#039;total&#039; =&gt; $totalFiles]);
  } catch (Throwable $e) {
    write_log(&quot;Error: &quot; . $e-&gt;getMessage());
    send_sse_message(&#039;error&#039;, $e-&gt;getMessage());
  }
}

function handle_download_request()
{
  global $resultsDir;
  $fileName = basename($_GET[&#039;download&#039;]);
  $filePath = $resultsDir . &#039;/&#039; . $fileName;

  if (file_exists($filePath)) {
    header(&#039;Content-Type: text/markdown&#039;);
    header(&#039;Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=&quot;&#039; . $fileName . &#039;&quot;&#039;);
    readfile($filePath);
    exit;
  }
  http_response_code(404);
  die(&#039;File not found.&#039;);
}

function send_sse_message($event, $data, $extra = [])
{
  echo &quot;event: {$event}\n&quot;;
  echo &quot;data: &quot; . json_encode(array_merge([&#039;message&#039; =&gt; $data], $extra)) . &quot;\n\n&quot;;
  if (ob_get_level() &gt; 0) ob_flush();
  flush();
}

function get_files_to_process($dirPath)
{
  $fileList = [];
  $directoryIterator = new RecursiveDirectoryIterator($dirPath, FilesystemIterator::SKIP_DOTS | FilesystemIterator::UNIX_PATHS);
  $iterator = new RecursiveIteratorIterator(
    new class($directoryIterator) extends RecursiveFilterIterator {
      public function accept(): bool
      {
        $current = $this-&gt;current();
        if ($current-&gt;isDir() &amp;&amp; in_array($current-&gt;getFilename(), EXCLUDED_DIRS)) return false;
        return true;
      }
    },
    RecursiveIteratorIterator::SELF_FIRST
  );

  foreach ($iterator as $file) {
    if ($file-&gt;isFile()) {
      if (!in_array($file-&gt;getFilename(), EXCLUDED_FILES) &amp;&amp; !in_array(strtolower($file-&gt;getExtension()), EXCLUDED_EXTENSIONS)) {
        $fileList[] = $file-&gt;getPathname();
      }
    }
  }
  return $fileList;
}

function generate_directory_tree($path, $filesToProcess, &amp;$treeString)
{
  $relativePathRoot = str_replace(&#039;\\&#039;, &#039;/&#039;, $path);
  $structure = [];
  foreach ($filesToProcess as $file) {
    $relativePath = ltrim(str_replace($relativePathRoot, &#039;&#039;, str_replace(&#039;\\&#039;, &#039;/&#039;, $file)), &#039;/&#039;);
    $parts = explode(&#039;/&#039;, $relativePath);
    $currentNode = &amp;$structure;
    foreach ($parts as $part) {
      if (!isset($currentNode[$part])) $currentNode[$part] = [];
      $currentNode = &amp;$currentNode[$part];
    }
  }
  $treeString .= basename($path) . &quot;\n&quot;;
  build_tree_string($structure, $treeString);
}

function build_tree_string($tree, &amp;$treeString, $prefix = &#039;&#039;)
{
  $nodes = array_keys($tree);
  $count = count($nodes);
  foreach ($nodes as $i =&gt; $node) {
    $isLast = ($i === $count - 1);
    $treeString .= $prefix . ($isLast ? &#039;â””â”€â”€ &#039; : &#039;â”œâ”€â”€ &#039;) . $node . &quot;\n&quot;;
    if (!empty($tree[$node])) {
      build_tree_string($tree[$node], $treeString, $prefix . ($isLast ? &#039;    &#039; : &#039;â”‚   &#039;));
    }
  }
}

function generate_markdown($dirPath, $filesToProcess)
{
  $treeString = &#039;&#039;;
  generate_directory_tree($dirPath, $filesToProcess, $treeString);

  $markdownContent = &quot;# TÃ i liá»‡u dá»± Ã¡n: &quot; . basename($dirPath) . &quot;\n\n&quot;;
  $markdownContent .= &quot;NgÃ y táº¡o: &quot; . date(&#039;Y-m-d H:i:s&#039;) . &quot;\n\n&quot;;
  $markdownContent .= &quot;## ğŸŒ³ Cáº¥u trÃºc thÆ° má»¥c\n\n```text\n&quot; . $treeString . &quot;```\n\n&quot;;
  $markdownContent .= &quot;## ğŸ“„ Ná»™i dung chi tiáº¿t\n\n&quot;;

  $totalFiles = count($filesToProcess);
  foreach ($filesToProcess as $index =&gt; $filePath) {
    $processedCount = $index + 1;
    $relativePath = ltrim(str_replace(str_replace(&#039;\\&#039;, &#039;/&#039;, $dirPath), &#039;&#039;, str_replace(&#039;\\&#039;, &#039;/&#039;, $filePath)), &#039;/&#039;);

    send_sse_message(&#039;progress&#039;, &quot;Äang xá»­ lÃ½: {$relativePath}&quot;, [&#039;progress&#039; =&gt; round(($processedCount / $totalFiles) * 100)]);

    $ext = pathinfo($filePath, PATHINFO_EXTENSION);
    $markdownContent .= &quot;### `{$relativePath}`\n\n```{$ext}\n&quot;;
    $content = @file_get_contents($filePath);
    $markdownContent .= ($content === false ? &quot;Lá»—i Ä‘á»c file&quot; : htmlspecialchars($content, ENT_QUOTES, &#039;UTF-8&#039;));
    $markdownContent .= &quot;\n```\n\n&quot;;
  }
  return $markdownContent;
}

      &lt;label for=&quot;project_path&quot;&gt;ÄÆ°á»ng dáº«n thÆ° má»¥c dá»± Ã¡n:&lt;/label&gt;
      &lt;input type=&quot;text&quot; id=&quot;project_path&quot; placeholder=&quot;VÃ­ dá»¥: C:\laragon\www\my-project&quot; required&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;

    &lt;div class=&quot;btn-group&quot;&gt;
      &lt;button id=&quot;btn-full&quot;&gt;ğŸš€ Táº¡o Full Docs (Ná»™i dung)&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;button id=&quot;btn-structure&quot;&gt;ğŸŒ³ Chá»‰ láº¥y Structure Tree&lt;/button&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;

    &lt;!-- Progress Area --&gt;
    &lt;div id=&quot;progress-container&quot;&gt;
      &lt;div id=&quot;progress-bar&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div id=&quot;progress-bar-inner&quot;&gt;0%&lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;div id=&quot;log&quot;&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;div id=&quot;result-download&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;#&quot; class=&quot;download-link&quot; id=&quot;download-link&quot;&gt;â¬‡ï¸ Táº£i xuá»‘ng file .MD&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
  &lt;/div&gt;

  &lt;!-- Modal Preview --&gt;
  &lt;div class=&quot;modal-overlay&quot; id=&quot;preview-modal&quot;&gt;
    &lt;div class=&quot;modal-content&quot;&gt;
      &lt;div class=&quot;modal-header&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div class=&quot;modal-title&quot;&gt;Structure Tree Preview&lt;/div&gt;
        &lt;button class=&quot;close-modal&quot; onclick=&quot;closeModal()&quot;&gt;&amp;times;&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;div class=&quot;preview-area&quot; id=&quot;tree-preview-content&quot;&gt;Äang táº£i...&lt;/div&gt;
      &lt;div class=&quot;modal-footer&quot;&gt;
        &lt;div id=&quot;copy-status&quot; style=&quot;margin-right: auto; color: var(--success); display: none;&quot;&gt;ÄÃ£ copy!&lt;/div&gt;
        &lt;button class=&quot;btn-copy&quot; onclick=&quot;copyTree()&quot;&gt;ğŸ“‹ Copy to Clipboard&lt;/button&gt;
      &lt;/div&gt;
    &lt;/div&gt;
  &lt;/div&gt;

  &lt;script&gt;
    const pathInput = document.getElementById(&#039;project_path&#039;);
    const logDiv = document.getElementById(&#039;log&#039;);
    const progressContainer = document.getElementById(&#039;progress-container&#039;);
    const progressBarInner = document.getElementById(&#039;progress-bar-inner&#039;);
    const resultDownload = document.getElementById(&#039;result-download&#039;);

    // --- LOGIC FULL DOCS (SSE) ---
    document.getElementById(&#039;btn-full&#039;).addEventListener(&#039;click&#039;, function() {
      const path = pathInput.value.trim();
      if (!path) return alert(&#039;Vui lÃ²ng nháº­p Ä‘Æ°á»ng dáº«n!&#039;);

      resetUI();
      progressContainer.style.display = &#039;block&#039;;
      this.disabled = true;
      document.getElementById(&#039;btn-structure&#039;).disabled = true;

      const eventSource = new EventSource(`?action=generate&amp;path=${encodeURIComponent(path)}`);

      eventSource.addEventListener(&#039;log&#039;, e =&gt; addLog(JSON.parse(e.data).message));
      eventSource.addEventListener(&#039;progress&#039;, e =&gt; {
        const d = JSON.parse(e.data);
        progressBarInner.style.width = d.progress + &#039;%&#039;;
        progressBarInner.textContent = d.progress + &#039;%&#039;;
      });
      eventSource.addEventListener(&#039;error&#039;, e =&gt; {
        addLog(JSON.parse(e.data).message, &#039;error&#039;);
        endProcess(eventSource);
      });
      eventSource.addEventListener(&#039;complete&#039;, e =&gt; {
        const d = JSON.parse(e.data);
        progressBarInner.style.width = &#039;100%&#039;;
        progressBarInner.textContent = &#039;HoÃ n thÃ nh&#039;;
        document.getElementById(&#039;download-link&#039;).href = `?download=${encodeURIComponent(d.message)}`;
        resultDownload.style.display = &#039;block&#039;;
        addLog(`âœ… Xong! Tá»•ng cá»™ng ${d.total} files.`);
        endProcess(eventSource);
      });
      eventSource.onerror = () =&gt; {
        addLog(&#039;Lá»—i káº¿t ná»‘i server.&#039;, &#039;error&#039;);
        endProcess(eventSource);
      };
    });

    // --- LOGIC STRUCTURE ONLY (AJAX) ---
    document.getElementById(&#039;btn-structure&#039;).addEventListener(&#039;click&#039;, function() {
      const path = pathInput.value.trim();
      if (!path) return alert(&#039;Vui lÃ²ng nháº­p Ä‘Æ°á»ng dáº«n!&#039;);

      const btn = this;
      btn.disabled = true;
      btn.textContent = &#039;Äang quÃ©t...&#039;;

      fetch(`?action=get_structure&amp;path=${encodeURIComponent(path)}`)
        .then(res =&gt; res.json())
        .then(data =&gt; {
          if (data.status === &#039;success&#039;) {
            openModal(data.data);
          } else {
            alert(&#039;Lá»—i: &#039; + data.message);
          }
        })
        .catch(err =&gt; alert(&#039;Lá»—i káº¿t ná»‘i: &#039; + err))
        .finally(() =&gt; {
          btn.disabled = false;
          btn.textContent = &#039;ğŸŒ³ Chá»‰ láº¥y Structure Tree&#039;;
        });
    });

    // --- HELPER FUNCTIONS ---
    function resetUI() {
      logDiv.innerHTML = &#039;&#039;;
      progressBarInner.style.width = &#039;0%&#039;;
      resultDownload.style.display = &#039;none&#039;;
      progressBarInner.style.backgroundColor = &#039;#27ae60&#039;;
    }

    function addLog(msg, type = &#039;info&#039;) {
      const div = document.createElement(&#039;div&#039;);
      div.textContent = `[${new Date().toLocaleTimeString()}] ${msg}`;
      if (type === &#039;error&#039;) div.style.color = &#039;#e74c3c&#039;;
      logDiv.appendChild(div);
      logDiv.scrollTop = logDiv.scrollHeight;
    }

    function endProcess(es) {
      es.close();
      document.getElementById(&#039;btn-full&#039;).disabled = false;
      document.getElementById(&#039;btn-structure&#039;).disabled = false;
    }

    // --- MODAL &amp; COPY LOGIC ---
    const modal = document.getElementById(&#039;preview-modal&#039;);
    const previewContent = document.getElementById(&#039;tree-preview-content&#039;);

    function openModal(content) {
      previewContent.textContent = content;
      modal.style.display = &#039;flex&#039;;
    }

    function closeModal() {
      modal.style.display = &#039;none&#039;;
      document.getElementById(&#039;copy-status&#039;).style.display = &#039;none&#039;;
    }

    function copyTree() {
      const text = previewContent.textContent;
      // Copy dáº¡ng markdown block
      const markdownText = &quot;```text\n&quot; + text + &quot;\n```&quot;;

      navigator.clipboard.writeText(markdownText).then(() =&gt; {
        const status = document.getElementById(&#039;copy-status&#039;);
        status.style.display = &#039;block&#039;;
        setTimeout(() =&gt; status.style.display = &#039;none&#039;, 2000);
      }).catch(err =&gt; alert(&#039;KhÃ´ng thá»ƒ copy: &#039; + err));
    }

    // ÄÃ³ng modal khi click ra ngoÃ i
    modal.addEventListener(&#039;click&#039;, (e) =&gt; {
      if (e.target === modal) closeModal();
    });
  &lt;/script&gt;
&lt;/body&gt;

&lt;/html&gt;
